Her reply?  "Oh, that shouldn't be a problem."

So what our hostess didn't tell us, after seating 4 additional smaller parties, that there was a boisterous wedding brunch on the other side of the restaurant and that our table would be greeted after the (one of two) servers was finished taking their order.

So they failed to communicate, but we'll have to deal.  After all, we had heard the place was remarkable.

After 23 minutes without a "Hello," and a waiter serving all four of those parties sat after us, the five of us started to get up - it's not a dine and ditch if you don't receive anything.  Only then did a waiter (casually chatting with a cook) dashed madly to our table looking suddenly concerned.

We rattled our requests off, and 40 minutes later we got our food.  I do remember the food being above par (after all, we had heard the place was remarkable), but the service left such a bad taste in our mouth, I will not step foot in the location again.

Small cups and no refills didn't help.

Short-staffed?  Sure.  But we would liked the heads-up on that one before we sat down under a time crunch.

After all, we had heard the place was remarkable.  Stay away.

Great service, fast cooks, delicious food, and a great price! This place was really good. THE BEST CRISPY BACON EVER! So good! Omelettes are delicious, the Nutella s'mores French toast is sooooo awesome, and the eggs were great! Coffee was good for a good breakfast place. We will absolutely go back!

So I have been coming to this Cracked Egg pretty much since it opened years ago. I say I average at least once a week or more either for lunch or breakfast.  Often hit the other locations as well depending on where my day brings me. That's a lot of pancakes.  

Always been a fan, and sad to say that the poor experiences that I have had most recently actually prompted me to create a yelp account. Normally I would just voice such concerns to the manager, but sad to say I don't really think he would be receptive.  He seems more interested in socializing than he does running this place to the standards set by the other Cracked eggs.  I hope the owner reads this, because i am one of those regulars that would always tell his friends about how good all of these restaurants were.  Not going to happen again.  I speak from experience as a customer, and as an operator. 

My last visit ,  four other tables seated... 10 minutes for a waitress to stop talking to her friends that she was eating with and come take my order.   Another 15 minutes  before the order came out (eggs, bacon, toast, fruit). This has become pretty much a routine occurrence.  Staff- I am not paying to watch you eat and socialize with each other, and your friends that you bring in.  And for life of Gordon Ramsey- don't sit down and eat yourself, then get up, not wash your hands, and then bring me my order when you feel like it-  WITH a mouthful of food!!!  Who does this??

Portion sizes have always been consistent as a rule with this brand. Lately, they seem to vary from huge to tiny.   Food costs must be a treat to chart here.  Flavors always varied, I guess depending on who is cooking as of late.  Cleanliness?  Brush crumb on floor- then step on throughout day.  

Oh BTW, the spill on the floor that nobody cleaned up... almost caused me to kill myself. But hey, as long as  the staff have time to text on their phone and update facebook between sitting down to chat with friends...what's one more dead customer right? 

No follow up on refills or up selling on staff's part anymore.  I am sure the owner is glad to know that rather than supervising, the manager generally leaves well before the staff at closing. Seen that at least a half dozen times in the last two months.  No side work, or clean up being done when slow.  Have seen tables take ten minutes to get bused, floors routinely filthy, and bathroom a horse wouldn't use. 

3 Visits in the last two weeks. Each one more disappointing than the last.  Staff generally unorganized and disinterested.  A continuous flow of new employee faces over the last few months tells me their is a general leadership problem.  I remember years going by where the same cashiers, busboys , waiters and waitresses were on like clockwork. At my last visit,  I heard one waitress tell another that she wasn't told if she was working  tomorrow????  Wasn't told yet by closing???  Communication is key in hospitality. 

Attention to detail no more.  The staff might not care about my $200 or so a month they will be losing in the future, but i am sure the owners might care about the 50 other customers like me who have been noticing the same race to the bottom. 

Good Evening...I'm Will McAvoy

I work the graveyard shift and i thought that i should take my family out to eat breakfast/lunch because we never have meals together like that anymore. The food and service was phenomenal, our waitress constantly checks up on us and the french toast was divine. The only reason I've given it a 4 out of 5 is due to the hostess. Apparently she saw us came in, but proceeded to move very very slowly doing what she's doing. Thinking to myself that we have to seat ourselves, but decided to wait and see if anyone says anything. Still standing for a bit and then 2 other groups came in We've all waited. Then she realizes "oh, there are more people maybe I should do something". Again, proceeded at a pace of a tortoise. As we dug into our meal, I've began to notice that she continued that trend with every customers walking in as if she doesn't know why she's working there.

Pretty decent!
Typical breakfast food.......omelets, scrambles, bacon and eggs, pancakes, etc.

The highlights:
~PUMPKIN walnut coffee cake.......moist and fluffy!
~Build your own skillets........ingenious!
~Lots of booths.  I'm not a table and chair kinda girl.

My complaints:
~The coffee tasted stale and it wasn't really HOT.
~My husband and I weren't greeted or even acknowledged for about 10 minutes after being sat.........NO BUENO!
~The set up of the restaurant at this particular location is pretty poor......front door, hostess stand, people waiting/people eating all in the same small area.  CLAUSTROPHOBIA!
Awesome food. They exceeded my expectations. Lisa was an exceptional server with a positive attitude. My coffee and water never saw the bottom of my cup. I'll be returning.

Loooove The Cracked Egg!  My go-to breakfast place EVERY time.  You get coffee cake or toast with your breakfast dish... the coffee cake is usually phenomenal!  It's just dependent upon my mood.  They've had the same people working there for a while now and now that I think of it... I don't believe I've EVER had a bad experience with my service.  Whether that be waiting on refills, waiting on food, the way I was treated.  I know most people love hash browns... but TRY the seasoned potatoes!  They are amazing!  Sooo good, the seasoning is to die for... a great addition to any dish.  I've tried skillets, omelettes, scrambles, sandwiches.... and have never been disappointed.  The only time I didn't absolutely looove something was when it wasn't something that I normally wouldn't go for anyway.  All in all, it's definitely worth checking out if you have never been here.
Loved the biscuit and gravey with poached egg...omg so good. Service was fast and food was hot. Cant ask for anything better.

A little on the pricy side. 9.00 for eggs and bacon

I decided to stop by here to try something different.  I got tired of eating the same thing over and over again.  I got seated right away which was awesome since i was on my lunch hour.  Imagine my surprise when I saw the sticker price on the items.  9.00 for eggs and bacon.  The bacon was extra crispy just as i like it but i don't think i can justify spending that much money on just eggs and bacon.  The food was good but the price was just too high.

My husband and I LOVE this place! We have been coming since they opened. We used to travel to the Rainbow location until they opened this one up near where we live. The food is delicious! They have the best eggs benedict in town and I have tried almost everything in the breakfast menu and everything is great! The atmosphere is great and they have a great staff! Love the service!

I wouldnt say that its a bad place, but it certainly does not live up to the hype or 30+ minute wait on a Sunday morning.

Service was lacking and while they were busy, I made eye contact with our waiter several times while he stood around chatting with the other staff. We received only one drink refill (which was long before our food arrived) and had to wait at least 15 minutes after finishing for our check.

I had the "country benny" (biscuts and gravy with a poached egg) which was bland and tasteless. Making matters worse was the fact that it must have sat out for a long time while my wife's food was prepared - cold and the breakfast potatoes (uninspired but decent enough) were soggy.

I am not the type to send food back, but I would have had our waiter bothered to stop by.

I was impressed that the front staff seemed to actually care when I responded honestly to the standard, "How was it?" during checkout. They offered to get the manager and I'm sure would have made it right, but I had already decided not to return.

For Denny's it would be acceptable, but for nearly $15 a plate and an hour wait? I think not.

I don't know how anyone can go to a place like IHOP or Denny's voluntarily when they could go to The Cracked Egg. My girlfriend and I had had the worst night of our lives, our dog was in a veterinary hospital overnight sick - we didn't get much sleep (there was a lot of weeping involved). We woke up, knowing we would pick him up at noon and thought - goddamn it, I deserve a good breakfast after all this! And the Cracked Egg is that kind of place. This is food and service that could mend you, body and soul...

I ordered their croissant sandwich and my date ordered an omelette with bacon, cheese, and avocado (the serving of avocado was very generous - for those wondering). We both opted for hash browns. The hash browns here are WAY better fare than you would get elsewhere, although they are greasy to a fault. Still, it's like IHOP hash browns on steroids. These hash browns would make IHOP hash browns pee their pants in fear. It reminded me of something my grandma from Oklahoma would pull out in the morning, made in a skillet - low on presentation, high on deliciousness and love.

The wait was manageable if you're an early riser, service was extremely prompt. We received several offers of more coffee, water, milk etc, were asked if everything was good, from many different waiters and our main waiter was smiling, happy, and clearly a kind guy.

We ended up spending $30, around $15 per person for three drinks and two HUGE platters of food. For the quality and service (and the fact that you're supporting a smaller business) it's worth it.

Food is decent, close to our house. I would give it a higher rating but my water glass and coffee cups remain empty most of the time. It's hard to get the waiter's attention for refills. Also, I can't believe they only give military discounts if the member is in uniform. Evidently a government issued ID card isn't enough. We've tried this place several times but from now on I'll drive an extra 15 mins to 'that other egg place in town' where their clever little egg sign allows waiters and waitresses to know when you need something. Oh yeah, and there a military ID card is enough to get a discount anytime.

Stick to ordering the basic breakfast items, and arrive at the butt crack of dawn if you don't want to wait. Those would be my suggestions.

As much as I enjoy devouring their simple, yet tasty bowl of oatmeal, I would probably have to stick with that option if I were to return to The Cracked Egg. On my last visit, I tried the GVP omelette, which is served with a choice of potatoes or hash browns, and a choice of toast or coffee cake. The coffee cake arrived piping hot, which seemed like it came right out from the microwave. I couldn't stomach the omelette. Maybe it was the mushrooms and spinach combo, or just too much of the stringy Munster cheese, but it just didn't taste good. 

So long, Cracked Egg. From now on, I'll be heading up the road to IHOP.
Amazing!!! We've been coming here for years. We love the food and we love the staff. This business model is a winner and keeps the customers coming!! Excellent everything, thank you!

Not all it's cracked up to be!  I'm not sure why this place gets such high marks when the service is horrible and the food just so-so.  Went to The Cracked Egg for breakfast with co-workers today and ordered the Big Bad Wolf omelet with sour dough toast, seasoned potatoes and coffee.  The omelet had no seasoning on it and was overcooked (dry).  Their "seasoned potatoes" are the frozen bagged stuff you can buy in any supermarket, I think I have a bag in my freezer at home.  The coffee was good, except when I asked for a warm up the waiter topped off my cup with cold coffee and made the half cup I already had colder. 
The service was terrible!  I had to get out of my seat twice to walk over and get the waiter for the table, as he took the orders and felt he was done.  For the price you pay, spend your money elsewhere!

The Cracked Egg is a great Mom and Pop Brunch Cafe with a few locations in town. They have the BEST Biscuits and Gravy I have ever had. The Croissant French Toast is good as well as their omelets. They have decent prices and good old fashioned comfort food that keeps me coming back. However, I find it quite annoying that most of their dishes don't come with a choice of sausage or bacon and it cost an arm and a leg to order it on the side. Their bacon and sausage on the side costs more than buying it at a grocery store! Seriously, they are cheap meat so I don't see why they charge so much. I like sweet and salty meals. I just can't have one without the other. A girl needs her protein.

To trash this place is to not understand what a good breakfast place is. The wait proves their worth and the dishes are prepared to perfection. The only real downside is showing up late on the weekend. And the OJ is not unlimited refill. All in all, one of the best in town especially with the local coupons which are usually B1G1
So impressed with the service and the food! I definitely will be back! Everything is so fresh!

My wife has been wanting to try this place for awhile so we finally went there. Ordered corn beef hash and found a nice LONG BLACK HAIR IN MY FOOD! Neeless to say I immediately lost my appetite, but these things do happen.  When I told the waitress I thought they should comp my drink as well, she called the manager who said he wouldn't comp the drink but would make me another meal. At that point the last thing I wanted was more food from them. Seemed kind of insulting and keeping the customer happy seemed like the last thing on their minds. Won't be going back.
A great place to get fresh home cooked food. I love their coffee cake!!!

I've made two trips here. First time with my husband, we came on a Saturday morning and sat outside. I got Tori's tortilla with turkey sausage subbed for the chorizo. I got the coffee cake which was good..I was expecting something denser but it was super light-textured. Another  yelper suspected a cake mix but I bake a lot and it seemed house-made legit. My husband got French toast and eggs...I had a bite of his French toast and it was good. My burrito was excellent...packed with veggies and scrambled eggs and cheese...I was super happy they have green Tabasco too. 

Second visit was with my mom on a weekday morning. We were seated quickly and were soon drinking coffee. We both ordered a special - sweet potato skillet with cranberry sausage and eggs. We also got coffee cake. Like the first time it was super fluffy and had a good flavor but I'll just get toast next time and save some calories for eggs and cheese ;)

Skillets were good...I would have preferred more veggies and fewer sweet potatoes but I am a big veggie fan so take that Into account. I would have also liked something more acidic thrown into the mix so I ended up asking for my fave green tabasco again. 

Service was good, nice variety and good quality of ingredients. Next time I plan to try lunch.  They offer coupons every month on their website but make sure you check that out before you go as they need to be printed.

One of our fav places. Service is prompt. Eating outside on a nice day is perfect. Nice outdoor patio. Western omelet is my go to breakfast and hash browns are crisp and tender. Ask to have Ms DaAun be your server, she's awesome!

We had to take my car into the shop early on Saturday morning so we considered grabbing some breakfast in the area as well.  After checking my Yelp! bookmarks - I was happy to be reminded of the newer Centennial location of the Cracked Egg as we'd been going to the original Cheyenne location on and off for about 8 years now.

This location is a lot less crowded with a shorter wait time and a much larger seating area - all decorated in a traditional country-kitsch motif.  I liked the fact that they have enough room to set the tables further apart here, it makes the space feels much more open and airy.  I'm a big fan of the Cracked Egg's Veggie Benny and it was equally as great here.  Two English muffins topped with spinach, poached eggs and hollandaise please - diet be damned!  I prefer my breakfast with hash browns rather than fried potatoes and they do a good job here - taking the time to let the outside get all nice and crispy while the inside remains soft and buttery (if there's one thing that makes me sad, it's undercooked hash browns).  The service was friendly, welcoming and efficient.  I'd definitely come back to this location again, even if it is a little farther from my house - just for the shorter wait.
Great place! Great service! I had the Philly, my friend had an omelet with the coffee cake. Recommend the coffee cake.

Yumm! Breakfast, my favorite meal of the day. There's a reason why this place is always so crowded, it's delicious!! 

Very similar to The Egg & I down to the seasoned potatoes and hustle & bustle. The noise level is very loud, it's what you'd expect of the breakfast/brunch crowd. So if you're looking for a nice quiet breakfast this place isn't for you. 

Many options on the menu. The Californian with egg whites always hits the spot. I'd pass on the coffee cake though, it's more like a square piece of cake with frosting drizzled over the top. Sadly, it didn't taste like coffee cake at all, boo. Good prices but the service can be hit or miss. All in all, when you're feeling too lazy to make it yourself come here for some good ol' comfort food.

I come here all the time and never had a bad meal or horrible service :-) They are wonderful with children too! My toddler started getting restless and the waitress came right over with goodies in hand to help calm my little one down :-) Yummy food, sweet and attentive servers, good prices, why eat any place else? Plus when your done eating just go across the drive way and hit some golf balls on the painted desert golf course :-) Perfect Sunday morning

The "Haizley's Hot Link Sandwich" is wonderful. It has a lot of flavor and is a treat for your taste buds. But it is also very messy!

I keep thinking I am going to branch out and try something new but I just can't resist it!
We ordered an omelette and it was good, it was a bit brown though. The prices for their sides are a little ridiculous, $1.50 for a side of sour cream.

Reasonable prices but a little higher than chain restaurants you see across the country.  The coffee cake is sinful and tasty.  Breakfast & lunch menu but only until 2p, by the time I think to come here, they are already closed.  Too bad.

Just moved to the north west and came to try the cracked egg with my family it was an awesome breakfast experience. Great kids menu. An awesome selection to choose from breakfast classics and lunch and there eggs Benedict is amazing. It's a must try in the north west and we'll be coming back on the regular for breakfast.

How good can eggs be? Pretty damn good here. There is always a wait on the weekends but I dont mind 20 min for the delicous food. Even when they are a super busy the service is great. 

Today I tried the Joes and wifey had the north shore. Bomb. I love the coffee cake and the hash is really good which is what I usually get. 

There is a long wait on the weekends for a reason. Its worth it.

I thought Cracked Egg was very good, but not great. Good variety and good food. The service wasn't anything to write home about, but nothing to complain about either. 

I had the peanut butter stuffed french toast, which was tasty but became too sweet to finish. 

My wife had the chile verde rancheros. She said she will definitely order this again, but it was a portion large enough for her to skip lunch because she was still full. 

We also shared the coffee cake based on recommendations on Yelp, and I would skip it next time. Tasted like a cake mix...

Expect to wait on the weekends, and note that the prices are a little high for a breakfast place, but not crazy. We'll probably come back, just not every weekend.

My family came here for breakfast on Christmas Eve around noon, and to my surprise we were immediately seated. Normally there's at least a 15+ minute wait for breakfast at the widely popular Cracked Egg. 

TWO EGG BREAKFAST ($6.99): Sometimes simpler is better. Served with hash browns and a slice of coffee cake. The scrambled eggs were cooked to perfection and the hash browns were on the crispy side, but still good. A nice dash of Cholula kept things interesting. Think of the coffee cake as more of a sugary pastry. The coffee cake has chunks of Oreo in the loaf and is topped with a sweet icing. It's served warm and in a generous portion size. 4/5 

HAM & EGGS ($7.99): My mom got hers with seasoned potatoes and over easy eggs. This a hearty breakfast for sure! She was very content with her breakfast meal. 4/5

CAKES & EGGS COMBO ($8.99): Two pancakes, two eggs, and two sausage or bacon. My dad was a fan of this combo! I stole some of his pancakes and they were moist, thick, and fluffy (basically everything you would want in a pancake). 4/5

CHICKEN SANDWICH ($9.99): My husband decided to be the odd ball and opted for lunch instead. He chose the seasoned potatoes as well - these tasted like french fries and were more lunch-y than breakfast-y. He said the sandwich was good and cleared his entire plate. 4/5

SERVICE: Our waitress was pleasant, accommodating, and stayed on top of things. Kudos to her for handling our party of 6 so well (two kiddos were in tow). 

The Cracked Egg is a solid spot for breakfast. It's even better when there's no wait!

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #2

I've been there twice, one time french toast, the second a Denver omelette. The french toast was dry and tough. The omelette was a lot of cheese and light on other ingredients. I've had better at Dennys.

I've been coming here for a quick breakfast spot since moving to this side of town. It's hardly ever quick but it's a usually a decent spot to grab a bite to eat in the morning. However, after my visit today I won't be dining here. 
I got a garden skillet as usual with a side of toast. I ate a half a slice of the toast. Later grab another piece with noticed a strand of blonde hair. The individual I was dining with has brunette hair and mine is black. Clearly not our hair. The server stopped by our table and I brought it to her attention. I placed the toast on a separate plate and she took it away. Upon waiting for our receipt the server stated she took the charge for the toast off. Since I only had one cup of coffee I didn't feel the urge to make a comment that my entree came with toast there was no extra charge for her to take off. However, that didn't stop my friend who talked to the cashier who grabbed a manager who said yeah she gave you guys $1 off the cost of the toast. Oh and the tone of voice and body language was absurd. We paid for our check and left. Oh and we left a dollar tip for our waiter too. Hope she can buy herself a piece of toast one day. Jk That's a bit harsh but nothing compared to today's service. It's never about the money it's about the experience.

We went early (8AM) for Sunday breakfast ( family of 7).  There was certainly plenty of food ( but is quantity better than quality?).

I had Tropical French Toast.  Too much toast too little flavor.
Hubby had Cheeseburger and Bacon Skillet...just toooo much.
Kids had a variety of eggs and toast etc... nothing tremendously exciting.

Only drinks were orange juice for 3/7 and the bill was $88 with tip.

Service was satisfactory ( not outstanding).
The place became quite busy by 9AM and would certainly be standing room by 10AM.

Can't give a bad review, all the food was OK and there was alot.  BUT not a place I would go to week after week.

The coffee cake ( tasted my sons) was good but not the best I ever tasted( a little dry).
Great service, waiters were very friendly and prompt. They were good about asking if we wanted more coffee or water. The only downside because the food is so good is there will most likely be a wait.

I was really looking forward to a good breakfast, and assumed this place was owned by the same people as The Egg and I, but the menus are not the same, so I think they are just trying to use similar fonts on the sign.  

Anyway...not impressed at all.  The prices were very high for breakfast, and the food was not great.  The fillings for my omelet were diced so finely that they were hard to find, and the cheese was just sprinkled on top, so it wasn't a very cheesy omelet.  The seasoned potatoes tasted like frozen potatoes cooked up with some seasoning put on them, a little too chewy.  My husband wasn't happy with his meal either.  Everything was basically rather bland.  The service was friendly and prompt, so no complaints there.     

I already have plenty of favorite breakfast places, and unfortunately this one didn't hit the mark.

1st time  eating here , the server was so nice and patience  .  We order the Joe breakfast and it was delicious   along with French Toast  with peanut butter . We had a great time and the place looked clean . I will definitely  go back and try more stuff
Very mediocre and overpriced. The breakfast potatoes are Sysco. That pretty much says it all.

Fairly disappointed. "Homemade" coffee cake was clearly boxed cake mix with raisins (?) on the bottom. Bacon was ice cold. Dense pancakes. Not worth it. Also why is everything on the menu in quotation marks?

Visited this morning for breakfast and were seated right away.  The service was excellent, but the food was fair.  My Big Bad Wolf omelet was actually tough, you almost had to cut the eggs with a knife.  The potatoes were well seasoned, but very dry.  My wife ordered ONE banana/walnut pancake, and she loved it.  Problem is; the dang thing cost $5.50 for a single, small pancake.  Overall, just average.
Food is AMAZING. Service is very nice! Location is beautiful and clean and very comfortable. Hard not to hang out all morning  10/10

This place is ALWAYS always busy, so be prepared to wait a little (especially on weekend mornings) but it is seriously worth it. The decor is so warm and welcoming, and the service is always good. Breakfast food is usually breakfast food, but I actually CRAVE this place, its so good! They have a big menu too, so there's always an opportunity to try (and love) something new every time you come. I've been to two of their other locations and it's consistently good with great service at each one. Don't go to ihop, go to cracked egg instead!

came here for breakfast.

they were OKAY. the menu was super exciting to look at but the overall experience was mediocre.


my bf and i ordered (we ate half and then swapped) :

"the Californian" (half a avocado and two full slices of bacon in the omelet and some jack cheese on top) 
  -it tasted good, but it wasn't anything special, probably could have made it at home for less than i paid for.

"the GVP" ( lil mushroom, lil spinach, half avocado and muenster cheese topped with sour cream) 
 - wished there was more filling to it, it was mostly egg. tasted almost the same as the other omelet.
 
it comes with toast or coffee cake and hash browns or potatoes. 

when i first saw the plate i was surprised at the portion size!
... but then  remember how much it cost.   $10.  

i left that restaurant filling unsatisfied.

by all means the quality is much better than denny's or ihop, only if you want to shell out the extra bucks to pay for it. 

if you're on a budget, i would suggest making you're own breakfast at home, unless you're a horrible cook, its going to taste around the same.

i would go back one day just to try out some of their lunch items out of curiosity but i'll pass on breakfast.

Had the Tropical French Toast today. It was HUGE! No way I could even eat half of it. Highly suggest sharing. I wonder of they offer half portions.... But it was tasty. Loaded with toasted coconut, and a sliced whole banana.

After my second visit I'm finally writing a review. If you're visiting from out of town or a local this is the spot for breakfast. It's about a 2 minute drive down Charleston from the Red Rock Resort and just a few minutes from Badlands golf course. 

On this visit I brought my family. My son was begging for room service but since he decided to wake up at 6 am I decided to drag them out for a real breakfast. Service was excellent! Ordered drinks and they were out before I could check in on yelp. The coffee here is really good. I like the mugs they serve in. 

Kids menu is simple and all of the items are inexpensive. The kids each wanted an order of chocolate chip pancakes but I think they could have split an order because the pancakes are a good size and dense; 7 yr old had 1 and 5 yr old had .75 of 1. 

Wife ordered the garden veggie omelette, $9.85. Comes with choice of hash browns or house potatoes, and choice of toast or coffee cake. Do yourself a favor and splurge on the coffee cake. It's a whole lot of food. I went with the sweet potato skillet, $10.75. Has the same options as the aforementioned meal. All that food was only $41+$10 tip. One of my favorite breakfast spots.

Right now the coffee cake has gingerbread cream cheese filling, probably a seasonal thing because of Xmas time. Last time I was here in summer the regular coffee was just as good. 

Stop by for breakfast if you are hanging out by red rock. They do have several of these establishments around Vegas. Hope you get to try it out. Happy eating!

My boyfriend and I have gone here two times for Sunday breakfast and both times have loved our meal and our experience so much. I've ordered the country fried steak and gravy, no eggs, and with potatoes both times I've been and it's been amazingly delicious each time. I also ordered coffee cake both times and both flavors were not a disappointment at all. My boyfriend ordered the croissant sandwich and the Mexican skillet and enjoyed both, but wants the country fried steak and gravy next time we go. I definitely recommend it!

The prices are reasonable for the food you order and the portion sizes are decent. I've never left the restaurant still hungry or too full. We've had no problems as far as service goes with our waitresses being super friendly. There are lots of servers and staff walking around to check on tables and maintain a clean dining room. Both the indoor and the outdoor seating areas are nice to sit in. I recommend the outdoor seating only early in the morning when it's not too hot (this is Las Vegas after all). Also, just a side note, this place does get relatively busy in the morning for breakfast and brunch, so prepare for a short wait, even for the outdoor seating area usually. I expect there is about a 30-45 minute wait during peak hours, so around 10-11:30am.

Service was great, food came out pretty fast. You really want to try their delicious coffee cake! The omelette I order was okay, food presentation can definitely improve. Overall, it was a good breakfast place.

This place has great food and really nice servers, BUT it is a struggle to order vegetarian dishes.

We wanted to substitute veggies for meat on an omelet, but were told no because their policy is meat for meat substitute only.

This is the first restaurant that hasn't accommodated vegetarian needs. I would have given a higher rating had it been different. We won't be coming back because we can't eat here.

Decided to try the The Cracked Egg because of their gluten-free offerings but was disappointed.  Husband & I had lunch and then gave another try at breakfast the next morning.  Not wonderful either time.  GF pancakes were not cooked all the way through leaving gooey middle.  Lunch had problems as well.  Service was not the best either.

Went for the first time yesterday after working out. The service was great. The menu has plenty of choices. My wife ordered a skillet which was great. I ordered the Chili Verde Rancheros and the regular hash browns. I am glad they serve regular hash browns.

The coffee cake was tasty however, have you ever microwaved coffee cake and it is really hot in the center plus has a feel that screams microwaved? It was kind of like that. I would rather have a piece of warm coffee cake that did not pass through a microwave(just seems like it did).

My meal was very tasty but the shredded pork in the Rancheros had hard edges like it had been sitting out.

Lastly, when we walked in and asked for a booth, the hostess gave us a gas face as if by asking for a booth we were throwing off the table rotation by not taking a two top.

But...we will be back. If I did not like the place it would get less then 4 stars

Seriously this place is overrated. It is just a so-so breakfast/brunch spot. I took two groups of students out to breakfast on two different days and tried the waffles one morning and the omelet the next. I was not overly impressed and the students were polite enough not to complain and look a gift horse in the mouth, but no one (and this was a sample of over 12 meals) was raving about their food.  There are not many options outside the Red Rock, but if I ever go again I will definitely try to find something better.
Expect this place to be packed EVERY SINGLE time you visit. The food is that good. The coffee cake alone is worth the wait.

I have been meaning to try this place for a while. Today I got that chance and this was so mediocre and blah I would have been better off going to McDonald's for a better value and not have to tip a waitress who reminded me of a robot. First off there was enough salt in this food to start my own Salton sea. My measure of how the rest of food is at a new restaurant is the Eggs Benedict so I always try that first...big pet peeve alert....why do restaurants insist on serving crappy powder mix hollandaise ..IT SUCKS.....is it so hard to put in some extra effort to make homemade sauce?..the seasoned potatoes tasted like they were put on a conveyor belt of salt and run thru like 20 times...i paid 2.45 for coffee..and 3.75 for an oj...total rip off..im tired of mediocre crap being pawned off on the public in order to keep the owners of these places from losing money. the waitress was going thru the motions dropped my check before i was even finished,did not ask if i wanted a warm up on my coffee nor a to go cup for my Starbucks costing java...The verdict is more crap service and food for 21 dollars..at least McDonald's is consistent....after i ate this garbage i had to find a bathroom quickly as I got an instant irritable bowel reaction...such a pleasant way to start the day....me thinks not!!
"Country, Casual and Quaint" Breakfast is always delicious, wonderful staff and one of the only places in town you can get a monte cristo sandwich... Mmm!
Not bad. Service was decent, food was okay for the price. There are much better choices for breakfast. Great red velvet cinnamon roll though!

How many times can you say YUM during one meal? too many to count!
Everything on the menu here is great. Never too much butter/oil and always leaves you full but not sick to your stomach. Waiting staff is always very nice and accommodating to all special needs. 
I would recommend all of the omelettes and the french toast for first timers. 
Oh and the coffee is surprisingly good.
Keep up the good work!

Service:  prompt and friendly.

Food: serving size was big but not too big.  Tasted nice.  Coffee was hot and well prepared.

Price:  Good for what you get.

This place never fails to impress.  The food is consistently delicious and the staff is wonderful.  More impressive, the quality carries from location to location.

I've tried a lot on the menu and yet to be disappointed, even lunch is good.  Mainly I come for breakfast though.  Scrambles, omelets and benny's... oh my!  I think the southwest scramble is my personal favorite.  Spicy and yummy just like me.  If spicy isn't your thing, try the south shore scramble.  Chicken and avocado will set you up for a good day.

Got to start off by saying that their mocha coffee cake was to die for and its been the only thing on my mind these past few days. It comes to your table with legit steam still, super hot, moist & delicious. I ordered a Denver omelette and it was great. I do have to say that Egg works Denver omelette was just the slightest bit better BUT.. The coffee cake and delicious potatoes at cracked egg will definitely be the reason I come back!

I have been here twice and so far I have had a great experience.  Food is great especially the pumpkin coffee cake.  I brought my kids and they loved it.  It's not everywhere that you will find pb&j on the menu. Customer service was awesome as well.  There was one mistake but she fixed it really fast and with a smile.... Thank you everything about this cracked egg was awesome

Rock solid and consistently good.  While not my favorite breakfast place in town, it's probably the one I go to the most because it's the perfect blend of convenience, tasty food and an always friendly staff.

Location.  Parking right at the restaurant can be difficult.  If you dont strike gold and find a spot in front of the restaurant, just park in the large lot that spans the front of the shopping center facing Charleston Blvd.  Getting into the parking lot is easy, but getting out can be tricky depending on where you're trying to go.  The Charleston - Hualapai intersection can be a challenge.

The Food.  As mentioned, the food is consistently good.  Over time I've tried all but one of the omelettes (the Carnitas is my favorite), three of the "scrambles" (try the Southshore Scramble for something mild, or the Southwest Scramble for a little zing), and three of the Eggs Benedict (the traditional Eggs Benedict is my favorite, with a side of bacon).  They also have amazing salads for a breakfast place.  I've never ventured into the pancakes, french toast or other similar breakfast items because I love eggs for breakfast enough that I never seem to stray away from them.  My wife and friends routinely get these other items though and have never been unhappy.

If you have a gluten sensitivity, there's a significant menu for you as well, so dive in!

The Staff.  In the end, the Cracked Egg is a large chain, and there are a number of similar breakfast chains out there.  I've been to a few.  (I might like breakfast.)  Big chain restaurants are..well, big chains and honestly it's hard for me to give them a rating higher than a three.  In fact, I usually don't review them unless they stand out for some reason.  In this case, the staff at this Cracked Egg location is what makes this a four star review.  So go, enjoy the food, and let the staff take care of you.

I came in half an hour before they closed. The first thing the hostess says to me is they close in 30 rather than greeting us. Within two minutes of sitting down the waitress in the next section over is talking horribly about the table across from us with one of the managers. Hopefully they reevaluate their customer service skills and take their personal opinions in the kitchen next time instead of in front of their guests
Great place for breakfast. Food was excellent and cute atmosphere with creative signs

I really love this restaurant, their food is amazing! I always have the cracked croissant and a side of coffee cake, and they're delicious. I've had their biscuit with gravy and it is by far the best side I've had in awhile. I'm a big fan of breakfast joints and think this one is by far one of the  best I have been too in a very long time. I highly recommend it.

Yummy coffee cake, ok food that lacks flavor development. HORRIBLY SLOW SERVICE. Oh and their fresh squeezed orange juice....isn't. Servers are aloof.  Won't be back. The Ann Rd location kills this one. The highlight was a really nice, polite and helpful busboy.
Since I moved to Vegas 3 years ago This place has always had great service and food. They are quick, efficient and very friendly. I recommend this place to everybody!

One of my favorite breakfast places in town. Food is always great. Servers are always busy but still give you the right amount of attention. South shore scramble is my every time meal. Loaded with bacon. (Get it without chicken it's better). Come here twice a month at least and always enjoyable. Any mistake in order usually comes from a busy kitchen but is fixed quick. Definitely refer for breakfast/brunch. Never order lunch but doesn't mean it's not just as good. :)

Plan for a wait on the weekends but it goes fast. The outside patio is nice if the weather is good. Food is typical breakfast eats but done well. My favorite is the corned beef hash - real corned beef and hashbrowns. I add the chorizo for some spice. Coffee cake is amazing, as are the seasoned potatoes.

Updated 7/5. By the way, after finally trying out a dish that was labelled similarly at its competition "The Egg and I", I was sorely disappointed in their version. Way to win the battle of the breakfast!

Stopped in on a Saturday morning after a hike at Red Rock Canyon. Glad we did! Seated immediately. Hostess was friendly. Waitress came and asked if we had any questions which she answered expertly and patiently. Our food came quickly and was close to perfect. I had the Veggie Benedict and my bff/husband had a tuna melt. Fabulous on all accounts. Entrees run about $10 on average. We left very satisfied and look forward to returning and trying the coffee cake which comes in different varieties throughout the day.

The hostess is completely scattered brain and rude. I understand this is a busy place for breakfast but I called and placed a order to go at 1:00pm and by the time I got there she never even put it in the system and told me that no one ever called. I showed her proof on my phone and then the next thing you know the manager came up and saw my order written down on the order slip. A little aggravated she then all a sudden remembered me calling and apologized. I work at a restaurant 10 x busier than this place and a mistake like this is very unprofessional. I hope they work on this or get a more suitable host.

Best effing breakfast in town! The chili cheese skillet is ev-ry-thing! Relatively inexpensive! The best hostesses and waiters/waitresses around. Tends to be on the busy side on weekends, the brunch crowd can get a little hectic, so expect at least a 30 min wait, but it's well worth the wait.

I wanted to try this since it reminded me of a couple other "Breakfasty style places" here in Las Vegas, but this is super close to home.

I have had two great meals here! And look forward to more!

Once was on a weekday, it was delightfully quiet, had great service and the food came out really quickly! Not a single complaint!!

The next time was on a Sunday, definitely not quiet..Because clearly the food is good! Not a problem, put our name on the list, sauntered over to StarBucks in Smiths (10 steps away), and headed back. With in minutes we were seated!
The Cracked Egg does not crack when they are slammed! That is a good sign!
OK, maybe the young male host looked a little shell shocked, but I assume he is new? But worry not, the seasoned girls kept it ALL together! Like a well oiled breakfast machine! A coffee station upfront while you are waiting could be a nice touch, but now I am just being nit-picky. I would happily go back anytime!

Over all, rock solid 4 star food! Great service! And an easy price point.
What is not to love about all of that?

Great restaurant   We called. Ahead to see what the wait time was an it was only 15 minutes for Mother's Day morning    The start you off with a bunn cake /Danish they were quick to take your order and it didn't take long to arrive. Victoria our server did a great job and help make recommendations.

This place is the reason why I finally opened a Yelp account... 
I wanted to take my boyfriend to breakfast for his birthday so I looked up some places since we are from out of town, and I decided to come here. The menu had a bunch of delicious options from peanut butter French toast to croissant egg sandwich. The variety of egg Benedicts caught my eye so I decided on the Veggie one with avocado, spinach and grilled tomatoes and my boyfriend chose the Pastrami Benedict and an order of chocolate chip pancakes. 
My order was a beautiful display and tasted even better than it looked. I enjoyed every single bite! My boyfriend loved his dish as well and we could barely get into the pancakes since we were quite full with our benedict plates. Price was reasonable for the amount of food and service was great, very friendly waitress and bright, welcoming, cute decorative setting. 
After leaving I believe I said out loud "that was the best breakfast I've had in a long time" about 5 times! I will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas and recommend it to many others. 
Thank you for a wonderful experience!

This is not the same flavor & preparation as the green valley location!! Everything was over cooked or burnt! If I didn't know better than I would never eat at cracked egg again!!! Stay away from this branch!!!! The rainbow & green valley are the best!

Was not impressed.  My coconut/macadamia pancakes were dry as a bone.  Literally.  They need to add whipped cream or something.  I also got their sweet potato fries...which were THE WORST i've ever eaten (dry, small portion, and almost inedible).  And how much were these sweet potato fries?  Seriously like 5 bucks!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  My hubby got their eggs benedict platter, and he was also unimpressed.  So $40 later, you're left feeling ripped off and still hungry.  OH MY.

Was pretty excited that a Cracked Egg was in close by my work. Thought I'd stop in. No wait, place was pretty nice, it's newer so everything is nice and shiny. Took about less than a minute to get our drink order but over 4 to get our waitress back to our table. She was tall, thin, short curly hair. She was ok, took order, told us our food would be awhile. DOn't know why, but ours took longer than everyone around us, we just ordered eggs and bacon with toast :/  finally got our food. It was nothing special. Had better, had worse. The only saving grace was the 2 for 1 coupon. Haven't been back. Probably wont be either.

Good food, good atmosphere and fast service. The coffee cake was great! They had colored pencils for kids to keep busy. The signs and decorations were cute. We were staying at the red rock resort nearby and this was perfect for getting out and eating somewhere else.

Bland service. Bland food. Over priced breakfast. I was willing to look past all of that as I frequented this place three to four times a week since I live too close for it not to be practical. When I was turned away because u wanted to bring my 5lb dog into the patio on a Sunday morning and get service only to be rudely turned away, that was the last straw. I will never be a patron of this place again! Rachaels kitchen is down the street and they are dog friendly!

My eggs were prepared just right.   Our server knew the menu pretty well and made suggestions which is always appreciated and we received service with a smile, that always makes the food taste better. Lol

First time here with a friend of mine. He had recommend it to me. First off.. The coffee cake! Oh god it is a must have here. Its so fresh, warm, and full of flavor! I ordered the Monte Cristo. It French Toast stuffed with turkey ham and cheese. Let me tell you what a wonderful and delicious combo this makes. We also shared the Coconut Macadamia Pancakes. Those pancakes give this establishment five stars alone. The service was good I didn't get the young gals name. If I'm ever by this side of town I'll definitely stop by again!

I want to put less than 1 star I didn't even have a chance to sit down and look at the menu when I was rudely turned away from the establishment because I had my dogs with me. Now I wasn't trying to sit inside, I was getting a table on the patio and have my dogs on the outside of the rail. The man said he was the owner, we'll I wish him the worst.

One of our favorite breakfast spots to go to. We go to this location the most. Gets crowded at times but it's pretty spacious compared to other cafes. They have plenty of seating inside and outside. Depending on the time you go , we usually go on Sunday's , a little later in the am and have never had to wait no more longer than 10-15 minutes for a table. For as early as they have to be up, staff is always friendly and welcoming. We've had Andi and Steve several times as our server and do an excellent job but from what I remember all servers are awesome. They are very attentive and genuine. My favorite dish is the cordon bleu skillet. If you're like me and love to eat sometimes thats just not enough. I get the banana chocolate chip pancakes as well and can get just one or a two stack instead the 3 but you have to request for it I believe. Just check the menu. They are really great about meeting your requests on substitutions too! Highly recommended to try.

Love this place! Our favorite local breakfast spot and we were so happy when they opened this location in Summerlin. We are always greeted warmly and seated quickly. The service is fast and efficient and the food comes out quickly. Always order the coffee cake instead of toast! It's delicious and so light and moist and served warm. 

I like the build your own breakfast skillet with the seasoned potatoes! I also like that they have vanilla creamers for my coffee :) 

Always a great experience and the food is always amazing. In my opinion, it's a little on the pricy side for breakfast but everything is now a days.
Food was deelish, staff was pleasant and atmosphere was casual. We will definitely be back for more

This is THE spot for breakfast in Vegas and I am a frequent flyer- you'll typically catch me here on a Saturday/Sunday once a week chowing down on a country benny.  I don't need a menu!  Seriously, you've gotta order their country benny.  The yolks are perfect and creamy (I'm salivating thinking of it now- it's almost pornographic!) thanks to a perfect cook every time!  The gravy has just the right amount of sausage, plus no paprika or green chiles or any other weird additions that you'll find in other breakfast joints.  The biscuits are always fluffy (once I had rock hard biscuits and they replaced them immediately) and I just love the rich combination of yolk, gravy, biscuit, and sausage.  I wish they were open 24/7, but I'm saving more money by only going in the mornings.

The coffee cake is fresh baked and always delicious.  I've never tried any of the cream cheese types, though (no thanks).  I've sampled some other things on the menu, but only when my boyfriend orders because I just cannot part from my one true love, the country benny.

I love you, Cracked Egg.  It's an unhealthy obsession, but the tongue and stomach wants what it wants.

Tried this place for the first time and loved it! Our new breakfast place! Talk about a delicious coffee cake! Sinful! My favorite is The Californian omelet ... And service is quick! You definitely don't sit hungry for long! The wait staff is friendly and overall a great environment!

Just moved to the area... 3 people at the desk when we walked in. The woman who greeted us was not exactly welcoming off friendly. Said hold on after asking us so how many?
I'm like good morning to you too.... 
There was a cute brown haired girl that has just started... She helped buffer that abrasiveness and was smiling and asked us how our day was going. ... GOOD JOB GIRL! ... I told the front, I think your employee needs a tab bit of training in customer service... As this is summerlin and I just moved here and first impressions are everything! ..... Went and ate at the bar in back... Service was EXCELLeNT and the food was delicious!!!!!! 

The MANAGER delivered our food and apologized... Well Played! Well Played! ...And we chatted for a bit. She's running a great Resturant!!!! I was very impressed with their quick response to my issue!! 

Wonderful! And I'll definately be back!
This was the first time and boy really good hot food even eating outside.We definitely had the best server SHARON .She is the best!!!!'

Oh my gosh food here is great. They have the best orange juice in the world lol!  Service is good. It's busy on weekends but the wait for a small party is not too bad. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs, it was delicious.. That orange though gave me life! Def coming back to pig out some more:)

Food was good, came out quickly. Love the spot its at. Only downfall was our waitress was horrible. She seemed like she didn't want to be there never checked on us, and just overall sucked. Other than that no complaints :)

Had the veggie benny! It was good! Im super picky and I enjoyed it heavy on the spin tho. I love this location. Last time we were here we chatted w our waiter about his dentist! My boyfriend loves the coffee cake

5 visits and it's always been great! The servers have all been friendly, helpful and cheerful. The food has been great and I've been getting from different parts of the menu each time. The only thing to keep in mind is you may have to wait 20-30 minutes during the busy hours, that's not incoming but keep it in mind (I've overheard others complaining about it while we've been waiting)

We come here almost once a week and we'll continue to do so !

Not sure what the high demand is about. Food wasn't bad but wasn't that good. We had great service from the front desk and waitress. Very efficient considering how busy they are. Nothing special. Wont be back. I ordered the enchilada omelette and my fiance ordered the Greek omelette. He agrees this place is OVER RATED. But again the atmosphere is upbeat and friendly.

Great place for an after ride revival! The staff went out of their way to get our larger group of hungry cyclists seated and served . I have to say... the service great and the plates  generous and tasty. Love the Sweet Potato Skillet!

The corn beef hash was just so so. The corn beef was not "hashed".Waitress should have warned me not to order the hash brown because there is already potatoes under the corn beef.  Should have sub it with fruits.

This breakfast place  is exactly what this area needs. Flooded with natural light,  cheerful and airy. Waiting stuff was friendly.

Next time I'll just order eggs over easy, toast and coffee. Other stuff on the menu looks too heavy.

Amazing food, the French fries are the best I've ever had, great prices ! I will return. Service was great, was seated in about 10mins on a busy Sunday after noon.! Thank you! 
No wifi. Which is actually a plus, I actually got to have a nice convo with family .
Excellent service and great food.  I sat at the counter with a friend, we had steak and eggs.  The breakfast was fantastic, with super attention. I will return, as well as recommend.

Great experience, food and service. Overall a really good vibe from the restaurant. The hostess seated us quickly and was polite. The waitress attended us right away as well and always checked if we needed anything else. When the food arrived everything looked and smelled delicious. I ordered the 2 cakes, 2 pieces of bacon and eggs along with a has brown and literally stuffed my face! Can't wait to go back again!
great breakfast. you cant screw up eggs but you can pancakes and they were great. fast and easy.

Came here for brunch on a Friday morning and my party of 2 was seated right away. Service was generally pretty quick even though the place seemed packed. I got the chile verde rancheros and at first sight it didn't look like much. It just looked like a big blob of food haha but every bite was delicious. Kind of tastes like a chimichanga lol overall, a great place for breakfast/brunch. They have a huge variety of food to choose from and the staff is really friendly.
Amazing food and great service. Enjoyed the Greek omelet and love the surprise of a different coffee cake.
Great service and food. Portions are good, been there many times, never an issue.

Start your day off right!!! Food is fantastic!!! Nice new store close to Red Rock casino. Breakfast is my favorite meal and never disappointed here. Staff is great, funny, fun yet professional. My all time favorite server is Rhonda, the tall blonde she's quite witty and always make me/us laugh!
Food is decent quality.  Brunette hostess was very rude and ruined the experience.  She refused to smile and pretty much threw the pen at me to sign my receipt.

My boyfriend and I came here because it was a nice stroll down from my house - the neighborhood feel was great - and it was sure busy!

We got seated immediately at a two top, although the weather was lovely enough to sit outside. The menu averages as a basic breakfast and lunch place with a traditional coffee cake offered as a side. 

My boyfriend ordered a classic eggs & bacon which is served with toast and potatoes and I was split between the Ole Benedict and chili skillet, choosing the latter. The food came out quick and hot within 5 minutes! 

Our waitress was decent if you include the business of the restaurant. Helpful and gave us attention when needed. Overall the food was great, enough cheese to satisfy the best fanatics. But nothing over the top in quality to make me a regular.

It's nice that it's close in the neighborhood as walking distance but I'll probably go back in a few months if I get a craving. 3/5
Great location...place is new and is nice. The service needs improvement. We waited. About 20 mins before anyone took our order...food is great on the other hand
Great food, good service. The "Veggie Benny" was delicious! (Only complaint- the waitress forgot to bring us more coffee).

I love this restaurant it's so close to my house not a huge wait time during there busy hours, food is always consistent and very reasonable prices being located in summerlin.My favorite item is the Las Vegas style chicken sandwich with the house fries! For some odd reason I can't help but want that sandwich  every single time I'm here lol

This place is busy and it seems it's busy for a reason.

The wife and I swung by on a whim for breakfast at around 9:30am on a Friday.  After a brief wait we were taken to our table.  Our waitress was pretty quick to get to us and after a brief bit of confusion over the day's specials we had our food no more than 10 minutes later.

Our food was quite good.  I had the special -- a pizza-inspired scramble -- and my wife enjoyed her chili verde egg dish quite a bit.

Not that we're up for breakfast all that often, but if we are and feel like going out instead of eating in we'll consider returning to The Cracked Egg.

The cracked croissant is to die for. I love to come here every now and then because you don't have to wait ridiculous amount of time for a booth/table compared to other breakfast places. Service is always good here, and they also have outdoor seating which is a plus. Food is amazing all my friends love this place. 5 stars.

Customer service is terrible at this location. We waited 20 minutes to be seated. Two customers came in a couple minutes after us and were seated before us. Needless to say we walked off and will not be coming here again.
Great food but really loud and crowded. This wouldn't be so bad if the support staff didn't seem overworked and overwhelmed.
Service was awesome! Thank you Amanda!!! She is the best sever ever!! Food was dank! I would come back in a heart beat

The overall attitude of this place seems catering to an elderly consumer base.  They don't offer wifi and this is explained by a sign that says "we don't have wifi, talk to eachother and pretend it's 1995, an obvious affront to younger more connected individuals who like to multitask while enjoying a morning meal.  

Our server seemed timid though he did well trying to personalize our guest experience.   it could be argued that the entire exchange was awkward and lacking a sunniness that one might find in someone with more experience.  We ordered our food and had to ask for more creamer, even though we placed the empty creamer container on the edge of the table.  

I ordered the low fat scramble and my partner ordered the veggie skillet.  I had the coffee cake as my bread and my partner ordered the sourdough toast.  

The lowfat scramble was actually delicious.  I would recommend ordering it with no salt.  This is how I ordered it and the dish was delectable!  There was chicken and tortilla chips which were not crispy because they were mixed into the scramble.  Not sure if they were meant to be crispy but it tasted good the way it was served.  The coffee cake was not very good at all.  It was actually a cherry jam coffee cake with white sugar frosting.  I wasn't expecting this for coffee cake in my limited experience is a plain sometimes cinnamon spiced pastry to sweeten your cup of Joe.  I would not recommend the coffee cake unless you are a fan of highly sugary items and cherries.  I am neither.

My partners skillet was the most lacking of the breakfast experience.  Again, it's hard to know what happened, whether the small differences were by design, the effect of a new or bad cook, or simply just a bad day in the history of the cracked egg.  For instance the seasoned potatoes were cold and seemed pre-made.  They were dark with seasoning even though I requested light seasoning.  The broccoli which came in the skillet was seemingly steamed, but the spinach was not.  So there was a mix of different cooking for all of the ingredients and it was off putting.    Also my toast was cooked fine.  

We ordered a waffle for the table and it came out soft and light. I wanted it cooked more but I didn't want to bother the waiter.  He asked the table next to us if they wanted their coffee to go, but once he gave us our check, he never once checked on us again.  We asked another of the wait staff if we could have our coffee to go and she brought us huge Styrofoam cups full of coffee.  Not what we asked for.  But still cool.  But a little excessive. But a nice gesture.  So anyways, we got a good experience in the end but not without some effort on our own part which somehow defeats the purpose of "service".   

When we finally told the hostess who was checking us out, she showed no remorse and offered no apology.  She just handed us our receipt and was over it.  Over all, we felt that the prices we paid did not reflect the quality of experience we received.  Too bad.
I had the carnitas omelet here the other day.  It really was more of a green chili omelet.  Nothing special; a decent place for a breakfast meal.

Fav breakfast spot by far ! Vegas is kinda my 3rd home so i try to find places to eat and go every time i'm in town . i don't eat meat so it's hard to find places that cater to my kind as well as carnivores lol veggies for life
Didn't know where to go off the 215 and saw this place. Even tho it's 1.6 miles off the freeway. It's easy to get there. Excellent food and friendly people. I recommend it. We had breakfast.

I definately would come here again, the service is great (she wanted to add me on snapchat) and the food it great. It is the perfect size and it is a great welcoming restaurant. I would prefer THE MONTE CRISTO, a ham and swiss cheese sandwich coated in french toast batter, and deep fried. 10/10 would totally recommend!!!

Met with a friend for breakfast, first time to this location and I liked that it wasn't crazy busy like it would be on a weekend. Our waitress was attentive and nice. I got a mix up with my order but she immediately fixed it. I got the California omelette, it was tasty but I wish they cut the bacon into prices rather than have two big strips in it to where u have to use a butter knife to cut it to pieces. The coffee cake was good, I just didn't have a sweet tooth at the moment. Overall all experience was pleasant.

Was here on Sunday. Waitress was fantastic. However we had ants all over our table & had to move. In addition the main reason we went there was to use the $8.00 credit that was on the rewards card I registered for.  However the manager informed me at check out that the credit would have to be used at a different time once the rewards company had mailed it out. Not only that but she was all but rude in how she explained it and was not even apologetic for the ant situation. You would think that under the circumstances she would have at the minimum offered to buy our drinks or something. So very disappointed with how this was handled.

My husband and I have been coming here since they opened. We have never had a bad experience. The food is always great and the service is always on point. I often mentioned to my husband that I never see a manager around. Everyone is dressed the same and always busy refilling coffee for customers, running food, rolling silverware, etc. The last time we were there we were checking out up front and my husband asked where the manager was. The woman who was checking us out WAS the manager!  I almost fell over. She was one I noticed refilling coffees and running food and rolling silverware! Talk about teamwork!!! I work at a restaurant where the managers won't move from the front of  the soda fountain when your trying to get drinks for your tables, much less run food or roll silver! I am so impressed with place!!

breakfast is my favorite meal! cracked egg is always so busy, and yet, they find you seats very quickly and the servers are always so joyful and give you quality time. they don't act rushed bit make you feel special and welcome. sweet potato skillet with bacon and apples was bomb!

After my doctor's appointment this morning, I stopped here for breakfast.  The place opened recently and I wanted to check it out knowing that it was part of a chain.

Before looking at the menu, one of the bus people came and brought me coffee. I first checked the specials board.  Then I looked over the menu.  After some thought, I went with one of the specials and ordered a Cordon bleu skillet.  The skillet had potatoes, chicken, ham, and swiss cheese and Hollandaise.  I got my two eggs over easy and rye toast.

In less than five minutes, my server brought the skillet over and it looked great!  It also tasted that way.  The chicken pieces were real chicken--not formed chicken.  The swiss cheese covered the top.  I was pleasantly surprised that the skillet was not heavy on cubed potatoes to use a cheaper ingredient to cut back on the ham and chicken.

My coffee was refilled without waiting and service was good.  I'm glad we now have a good breakfast place in the neighborhood.

Very basic breakfast, service at this place is horrible,,,do not sit outside, been there twice and same horrible service both times, coffee empty, bussers walking by not helping out.  I had to go to the host to get some attention to the table.  You can certainly do better than this place for breakfast.

Eggggg-cellent service, good food, good prices. Server was able to grab me the last piece of pumpkin coffee cake even though they ran out, it was a corner piece that I figure they couldn't sell so she gave it to me free of charge. What a sweetie! That's a winner in my book!
Great breakfast place.   Our food was delivered hot and quickly.  The servers we met were very nice and attentive.  We will certainly go back.
Medium wait, fast hot coffee, good food....what can you say, it's breakfast for the champions. The Greek Omlette, French Toast and short stack all received thumbs up.

This place is to breakfast as Wonder Woman is to star spangled knickers. The pesto scramble was ridiculously delicious. I descended on it in an egg frenzy, like a yolk smeared Cookie Monster who just finished an hour of cardio. The waitress was this chirpy, smiling maelstrom of efficient food delivery and coffee pourage. She even laughed at one of my jokes. Try this place. Just try it. You'll look back on that breakfast as the day dwindles and the golden honey light soaks your living room and think "Yes. That was good."

Today on 1/15/16 I had an urge both for blueberry pancakes and to change up things from the Grand Cafe experience at Red Rock. Based on Yelp research I chose The Cracked Egg because it has generated some good reviews and was very close to my hotel. My server, Tabitha greeted me with a smile and, very considerately, steered me to a larger table in the nearly empty restaurant. at 6:45 a.m., instead of compelling me to sit at a smaller table as many other places do. She provided the restaurant's extensive menu promptly and simultaneously took my order for coffee. The coffee was good and she diligently re-filled my cup until I cried uncle.I ordered two Blueberry Pancakes after she patiently explained that I had the option of ordering one, two or three, which the menu did not make evident.

The pancakes, unfortunately, tasted dry and leaden.They were not fluffy and light. They were hard to eat.They could not stand up to the excellent blueberry pancakes that I have had at Blueberry Hill restaurants during prior trips to Vegas. Perhaps the recipe can be tweaked because this is a family, and not a corporate, restaurant?

Prior to my leaving, Tabitha let me know where I could find some much needed cold medicine.It is the combination of her excellent service, the fact that my food experience diverged so much from the majority and the likelihood that I did not order the correct item that explains my decision to award an extra star.These factors would induce me to try The Cracked Egg again if I stay at Red Rock in the future.

To start off, some of the complaints people have about this place are ridiculous. One person complained they don't have wifi. Is your company or ADHD really that bad that you can't hold a conversation with them? Is multi tasking really that much more important than sitting back and relaxing for 45 mins? What could you possibly be doing that's so important that you really need wifi for anyway? And no. If I'm there trying to enjoy a meal on the patio, I don't want someone's dog there, regardless of breed or size. Unless it's a service dog, why would you expect to bring it everywhere like an accessory? I'm sure they would rather lose the one customer that was butthurt they couldn't bring their animal to breakfast instead of losing three or four customers that would want a dog there. As for the service complaints, there are no complaints from me. I came for a quick breakfast with my mom. Everything came out fast and hot. We were asked if we had everything we need and if we needed anything else, let her know. Then we were left alone to eat and have a conversation without the server coming by every few minutes interrupting us asking if we needed anything. If I we did need anything, we would have gotten her attention and communicated with her instead of rearranging some dishes on the table and hope that she could read our minds that we needed something specific. 
My mom got a veggie skillet which looked good, but not my type of thing. Plus I was craving their chocolate chip banana pancakes which definitely hit the spot. I also had scrambled eggs and sausage patties which you can't really mess up. If you think the food is bland, there is not much to do about that. It's all about personal preference and restaurants can't please everyone. They aim to please as many as they can, usually. Other places do what they do regardless of people's opinions. But that's usually certain types of food. Overall I've never had a bad experience here, and I would definitely go back. As for the price, meh, not too cheap or expensive. If you say you'd rather go to Mcd's then so be it. That's another case of opinion. Maybe you prefer that peculiar Mcd's flavor that's in all of their products. I'm not sure what that is, but I'm sure you know what I'm talking about.

Not a fan :( the food was average and the atmosphere and the staff didn't help much. The place felt like it was just a big efficiency machine instead of a nice intimate place to have a good breakfast with friends. I survived the breakfast but will not go back. I'm sure there are other places more to my taste...

I think this place survives due to its location. Our third time here and the entrees don't look or taste like anything beyond what you can do in your own kitchen. The coffee cake isn't worth the calories. It tastes like a boxed mix over a layer of jam. I will say the servers are nice and prompt. The food isn't anything  to write home about.

I was very irate with the staff as they do not know what the laws are when it come to service animals at this establishment, My friend who is a Gulf War Vet has a service dog for his PTSD, and was treated very rudely at this eatablishment.  I have been here numerous times, but never again and I will be sure to voice my opinion to everyone i meet.  We went to sit on the patio on a slow day and were told to leave and when we informed them that the dog was a service animal they said they needed proof, He then told them that that they were not allowed to ask for papers, and what kind of service animal he is and  tried to inform them that the 2 questions they were able to ask, "Is that a servcie dog?" "What has he been trained to do?"  the waitress walked away from us before he could finish..  I WAS SO IRATE AT OUR TREATMENT we decided to go else where to spend our money.  The fact that they have not trained their staff is no excuse.  I am more upset at this than my friend is.  They should take the time to review the Americans with Disabilities Act. Ignorance is no excuse.   The thing I was looking forward to this morning was the fresh coffe cake that they serve, but it is not enough to bring us back, and a fresh doughnut from Krispy Kreams is worth the drive, and they gave my friend some water in a bowl for his service animal as we had our doughnut.

First time at this location...1pm on a Tuesday. The food was good we got huevos rancheros and corned beef hash..but the service was ridiculously s l o w. It took 20 minutes after finishing the meal before the check was dropped :( good food though.

TRUE breakfast lovers be advised: very ordinary food. Great atmosphere, very warm and attentive staff, and an extensive menu of skillets, omelettes, griddle dishes and benedicts. But sadly the food just doesn't carry. Sorry Cracked Egg, I'll be back, but with lowered expectations for food quality. A typical 3 star experience
Stopped in with my parents for lunch had the North Shore Scramble, it's was better than I expected. Our service was good overall I would recommend stoping by if your ever in the area.

The Cracked Egg recently opened in Summerlin. There was a line out the door the morning we were there. The food was serviceable, but no dish stood out as something special. I had the low fat special. Which had chicken, green chilies, red salsa and tortilla chips. It tasted okay but did not look very appetizing on the plate.  It looked like a pinkish mash. The tortilla chips were also mushy. It seemed like they were trying to make a healthier version of chilaquiles, but the execution was so so. Still, it was eatable. My husband had the carnitas omelette which was fine. Our friends two of the skillets and the eggs Benedict. All of which were also fine. The best part of the meal was the coffee cake that they offer as a side. It's served warm with a sugar glaze on top. This place is an okay breakfast option if your favorite place is too packed. I think the wait that we experienced was because this is a new place. The crowds will die down after it's been open a while.
I am so glad they offer a separate menu for gluten sensitive folks like me. This is a very rare thing. Thank you, Cracked Egg! Good coffee too!

This place only gets a single star and that's only because our waitress was so kind. We were excited to come to this new location. Came after a walk with my friends and small dog. We sat on the patio and ordered. When the waitress was finishing our order she informed us we could not stay with our dog. We said okay we'll put her on the other side of the railing. She informed us she didn't think we could do that either. I informed her at other restaurants as long as the dog wasn't in their "dinning area" it should be okay. She left to ask the manager. The owner came out.....actually stood in the door way. In a very curt tone informed us I'm not serving you. I don't care what side the dog is on. No apology nor any sound of remorse or empathy in his voice. I see now why you and your partner have problems.  We left and had a lovely pet friendly breakfast at EGG WORKS
I'm a lover of Corned Beef Hash & Eggs so I thought I would try it. Far from the best and I think they skimp on portion for what they charge. Service and coffee was Great
Eggs and pancakes are fine here, but I branched out to the Monte Cristo today, and it was not just not good--it was GROSS. I'm so bummed and want my money back.
Cracked egg has  perfectly made hash brown. Staff is friendly and food is yummy. One of my favorite breakfast spots in Summerlin.
I could tell this restaurant was popular with locals by the crowd that was there on a weekday.  They fixed our breakfast perfectly.  I can't wait to go back to Las Vegas so I can eat there again.
Great breakfast place in Nevada. Fruit plate is fab! Sometimes you just don't know when it comes to fruit
Good Service. Pleasantly surprised with the food.

Went this a.m. For breakfast . We were seated immediately .the 1 st thing you notice is that the room has a high open ceiling . It was very noisy . Our waitress was very sweet and immediately brought us coffee. And offered us a nice warm strawberry coffee cake very yummy  I had an omelette of spinach mushrooms & Munster cheese it was very good. Although a lot of melted cheese. Which our waitress noticed I was scrapping off. And asked if I would like another one without . I said it was fine just the way it was ! Coffee kept coming . My companion had the chili skillet and he enjoyed it . All in all good food and service.

Our first trip & it was awesome! Our waitress, Cory, was super attentive and knowledgable of the menu. When I asked about the corned beef she assured me it was yummy and then went a step further and said if I didn't like it she would bring me something different! A+ customer service for sure.
