Honey had a "big bad wolf" omelette and it was perfect. The corned beef hash skillet was amazing - fresh cut corned beef cooked with the peppers, onions & potatoes. None of the greasy, overseasoning of most breakfast places. I did like the seasoned potatoes better than the hash browns. One of the highlights of this breakfast place was our toast. Pre-buttered, perfectly toasted bread & they had mixed fruit jelly. Truly awesome! If our next trip is this good, it will become a regular spot for us! 

Edit: too good to be true. 2nd visit. Our waitress, Natalie,  is awful. Dropped the check before she asked how we are doing. Slow on water refills. It's crowded again, but not too long a wait. Monte Cristo is terrible. Cheese isn't even melted. Both ham and chicken are still cold. I may just be spoiled by better sandwiches I've had other places, but the potatoes are on point. Honey had an omelette again, but the almost $3 up charge for sour cream and bell peppers is saddening. Our birthday girl had plain buttermilk pancakes & she is chomping away. Overall, I'm sad this place didn't live up to our expectations from our last visit & we won't be back any time soon. 

Gave it some time & gave them another try. This visit was much better. Coffee cake is great (red velvet) & our food was cooked perfectly. Our waitress, Andi, was great! Honey had the green scramble & he really liked it! Lots of veggies & th green sauce is awesome.

What you would expect from a country breakfast place l. Big portions and good quality. Usually long wait on the weekends but I guess that's not their fault people want to go there. If you're looking for a good breakfast in a chill environment this is your place but definitely not anything super special
Best home-cooked breakfast in the neighborhood, and a welcome new addition to this corner of the city.

Great place for breakfast!   I had one of the breakfast skillets and everything in it was perfect.  Everything I saw looked incredible.  I will definitely come back here a lot more.  It looks like the best place in town to get breakfast.  The lunch menu didn't look too bad either!  The few downsides of it, is I went on a Sunday at 11am and there was about a 30 minute wait for a table.  I don't know why they have such a small location for the business that they do?!   The service is a tad on the slow side, but they do get the orders right, so that's not a big deal.  However, if you are in a hurry, this is not the place for you.  It is in a busy shopping center to begin with, so the parking can be a bit of a challenge.  And it is very loud in there, so it you're looking for a nice quiet brunch place, this also isn't the place for you.   But if you don't mind these issues, the food is definitely worth it!
Love this place. It's my go to breakfast place. I recommend the chili skillet, California omelet, French toast... Everything is delicious. Service is fast and friendly.

Service is always amazing but today was extra special.. We slept in and woke up starving we didn't realize that it was almost 2pm (closing) we didn't even make it to the restaurant door when we decided to go back to the truck.. The manager on duty (light blue shirt didn't catch her name) ran out and grabbed us and invited us in! Food was amazing!! Chocolate chip banana coffee cake was great today!! Thanks to the whole staff! :)

My wife and I have been regulars here at least twice a week. The service and food, we have never had to complain.It also helps with their coupon. Today, after a great lunch, I tried to pay with their coupon and was told it is NOT accepted today due to the holiday. I asked what holiday and I was told Nevada Day. Yes, the coupon said no good on holidays, but I thought this was not a federal holiday, but a state holiday. I asked to speak with the manager, Juliana Yunis. With an attitude, she confirmed the above. No apology, just turned her back and walked away.  Do I dare walk in on All Saints Day?  As I said, the service and food is great, the manager needs to take a management course and at least smile. Left bad taste and will not return.
I finally found a great place to eat breakfast. The skillet breakfast is my favorite. I'm definitely eating here more often

I placed a to go order at 932am today by the time I arrived at the location at 950am our food was ready. The hostess greeted me as I walked in, told her my name, paid my ticket and drove back home. The easiest most convenient morning this week. The food was hot and very tasty. I will continue business with them.
Good food. Good service. Overall, just average for my taste buds. Had chicken fried steak and eggs. Gravy was good. Wife had tortilla Ranchero something or a rather. Again, not bad, but not great.

Haven't been seated yet but just a suggestion.... Maybe you shouldn't seat a party until the ENTIRE party is here. Been waiting for a table while 1 man sits at a 4 top waiting for the rest of his party to show... For the past ten minutes by the way.
I just love this place! din in or dine out! the food is good fun and if your good you can find out about their secret hidden menu! (cordon blue bowl anyone!)

Delicious breakfast spot! We were in town for a soccer tournament and dropped by here for a late breakfast. 15 minute wait at 10:30 on. Friday morning was a good sign. Great service. Great food. One star off for the pancakes being a little too chewy instead of fluffy and melty like I think they should be. But 5 stars for the Sweet Potato skillet. Like the best version of breakfast raclette.

| I take my cream and sugar with a hint of coffee! |
Coffee is always fresh. Orange Juice is always fresh. Took on the chocolate banana pancakes and my partnah in crime had the sausage, crispy hash brown , and over easy eggs. Add the coffee cake and pow... It's a power breakfast! Everything was superb. I love this joint!

I've been missing out.  Apparently The Cracked Egg is not affiliated with Egg Works or Egg & I (the usual breakfast spots I frequent).  So the original plan was to go to the new Egg Works in Summerlin, but my friend actually drove us to this joint which also recently opened.  

Saturday brunch - 25 min wait.  Well, let me take this time to walk over to Smiths and buy cookies and Cheez its.  At least there was something to do during the wait.

I give the food 5 stars.  All the dishes were super good.  We ordered:
- California omelette: bacon slices wrapped in an omelet with a sliced avocado on top, served with seasoned potatoes and choice of coffee cake or toast
- Hot Pastrami sandwich on a roll.  There were some bacon slices and cheese.  The seasoned fries were DELICIOUS, very seasoned and tasty.  Crispy, not soggy.
- Nutella french toast topped with mini marshmallows and graham crackers.  We thought this dish would be too sweet for one person's meal, so we shared.  Right amount of Nutella, it wasn't lacking.  Didn't even need to really dip in syrup bc it was sweet.  Only ate half of it.

Service was not the greatest, hence the 1 star deduction.  The coffee cake was never brought out, so we asked the waitress to pack it to-go for us.  We waited a while for the check.

I will definitely go back, but I hope the service is better.  If only this were Egg Works and they had that yellow egg on the table to notify servers when we need assistance.

I don't know if it is because I'm here hungry or what, but this place is delicious. A cute, unassuming spot that serves a stress free breakfast delight. I hope you are lucky enough to get Amanda. Note: Green Scramble

This review is a month over due.
This was may first time in this chain. I have seen these in San Antonio but never stopped.
We had a good breakfast.
When you go during the rush expect delay's like any place. Service was a bit slow but we had a wait for our table.
Since this is a chain I can only write about this location, but I hope to write about other locations in the future.
Everything had a good taste and I would definitely go to this location again.
Eggs cooked properly. Potatoes were good, seasoned just right.

I honestly wanted to love this place, but the food was very underwhelming.  I ordered eggs, bacon and hash browns. I found myself piling on the salt and pepper to give it flavor. My boyfriend ordered the south shore scramble with egg whites. His ended up being mainly cheese and chicken. The portions were decent sized but they lacked substance and flavor. My hash browns were a tad greasy and sat very heavy in my stomach all day. Bacon was too crispy. The customer service was good though. 

There's too many unique breakfast places in Vegas to go back to the Cracked Egg. 

I'm giving it a solid 3 stars because it's a basic breakfast. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great.

Service was good, food was good.
I have to say price wise it was a bit much but overall good experience.

The Cracked Egg is very similar to other popular "egg" breakfast joints but I don't believe they're under the same ownership. The restaurant is in a space that used to house a hipster slider joint so there are still remnants of a once trendy space. 

The service and menu is pretty standard for this type of place. I would recommend trying the croissant French toast if you're not in the mood for eggs. Eggs are the star here. The coffee is not. It's so weak that it tastes like hot water with an almost indistinguishable hint of coffee.

I know this is going to sound crazy because this is a breakfast place but do your self a favor and ask what soup they have for the day and if it's the baked potato soup GET IT !!! I ordered the Mexican scramble (I think that's what it was Called ) it was good had Jalapnoes and chorizo and cheese tons of flavor and went great with the potatoes . My next tip is you get a choice of toast or the daily coffee cake which comes out warm and is a huge square that you could share if you felt so inclined ( I destroyed the whole thing ) this place was busy but they handle it well our food came out fast and it was all delicious . If your in the area stop in !

This place has the best coffee cakes ever! Always friendly service, and very fast and attentive! Staff always has great attitude considering they have to be there early hours and have to deal with all the grumpy old farts that come in they still hold it all together!

Tried the Cracked Egg in Summerlin today (close to home) the breakfast was good, my wife ordered the ruben nothing special. Decor is good, clean.
Overall just OK, I think if I'm going pay $10-$12 per breakfast I'm going to stick with the the Egg and I, or Bagel Cafe.

I always forget about this place when it's breakfast time. Finally remembered and was so happy that I did. We went on a Saturday morning, it was busy but we were seated right away. The waitress was super nice and brought our drinks right away.

There were 3 of us. We ordered a cheese, ham and mushroom omelette with seasoned potatoes and 2 orders of Chile Verde Rancheros" An open-faced corn tortilla with Black Beans, Seasoned Pork and Two Eggs any style. Topped with Chile Verde Salsa, Jack Cheese and Sour Cream. These came with seasoned potatoes or hash browns. We chose the potatoes.

The Chili Verde Rancheros were to die for. I loved it so much we went for breakfast again the next day. Ha! I never do that. When we went on Sunday we only had to wait about 5 minutes.

This is by far the best breakfast place I have been to. A great local choice. Can't wait to return, I can taste the Chili Verde right now.

The food here is usually pretty good, especially if you're a fan of breakfast food.  I am taking off a star from the rating for the inconvenience while checking out.  I was using my debit card and they would not take it without seeing a driver's license.  I explained that my ID was in my car and I'd be using a PIN.  The girl behind the register insisted that was the only way they could take it and made me go get it.  So....if someone didn't have an ID with them, had no other means of payment and they had already eaten the food....I bet they would've taken it.

An elevated Egg and I. Menu is pretty standard, the food is good and price point is good. The ambience was odd-seemed empty. Overall a decent place to grab breakfast. Service was ok, they seemed understaffed.

This place gets only 1star as well because of the waitress was nice. One of the hostess as we walked in was rude and did not even smile. I commented for her to smile, the more she gave me this dagger look. We were excited about this new place but with what happened, it will be a while for the next visit.

First time here but what could possibly be bad at a place that offers you the choice between toast or frigging coffee cake!!??? 

BTW,  the best coffee cake  ever. 

The coffee was delish too. 

Just waiting for the mains to finish this place off... 

They're very crowded on a late Sunday morning so service is a little slow. 

OK,  wait is over food is here..... 

AND IT IS GOOD.......   Gotta go...  Food calls.

I generally like to give small businesses the benefit of the doubt, and tend to write reviews based only on positive experiences, as once can see from my reviews. However, there was one particular aspect of having breakfast here that has induced me to write a very negative review. The food (and the quality of the food for the value) was pretty mediocre, which would normally earn about a 3 star review from me. But my experience with a staff member working the cash register has earned this location something else. After finishing my breakfast, never having dined here before, I was unsure if I was supposed to pay the check to my waitress at the table, or I was expected to carry the check up to the cash register myself to pay. After waiting at the table for 5-10 minutes, I reckoned I should walk the check up to the front counter to pay. Upon reaching the cash register, I asked a young woman in her twenties behind the counter  - "should I pay here?" - to which she promptly replied while motioning back toward the rear of the restaurant - "No, you should pay it back there - in the bathroom." Okay, a young aspiring comedienne, not smiling at all, deadpan delivery, got it. I shrugged the comment off, smiled, and proceeded to pay the check. Upon completing the transaction, she once again went for the jugular - "Next time you come here, pay the check in the bathroom, see how far that gets you." Okay, that was a little bit TOO rude, inappropriate, and no longer funny by anyone's standards. While I was driving away, I was a little bit stunned that someone would be so pointedly mean-spirited not once, but twice. I contemplated driving back there and berating this young woman, but decided against it, vowing only never to frequent the restaurant again. Management should absolutely dismiss her. One or two of her fellow women coworkers were within earshot of this whole episode, and likely recall it, should management wish to take action.

This was our first visit to The Cracked Egg.  We are not local, but travel to Las Vegas regularly.

ATMOSPHERE:  This is a casual and roomy restaurant.  They make the most of their space, but it definitely didn't feel cramped in any way.

SERVICE: Average.  Our server was friendly and offered her suggestions when asked.  She was very busy with many tables.  I was a little disappointed when she dropped off the bill without us asking for it, or asking if we were finished with our meal.  But when I needed a box to take my food to go, we had to flag her down.

FOOD:
The Enchilada -- Had just the right mixture of ingredients.  The sauce to pepper to tortilla to egg ratios complemented one another exquisitely without overpowering each other.  The hash browns were crispy (at our request) and tasty.  The coffee cake side was warm, sweet and delicious.

Croissant French Toast -- very tasty.  The bread was a little chewier than I'd hoped for but in retrospect, some croissants are chewy so I'm not sure this is avoidable.  The berries were absolutely delectable - fresh and full of flavor.

Overall, we were very satisfied with this experience and would return.

First time here, last stop before heading to the airport and I am MORE than content, the food was amazing! Honestly the best breakfast skillet I've ever had. I asked the server for a recommendation and she recommended exactly what I was debating on! I had the Country fried steak skillet and the coffee came it came with was also super delicious and freshly made, definitely definitely recommend this place to anyone passing through, arriving, leaving or even lives here but hasn't tried it lol I had Tabitha as my server and she made the experience that much better, will be back very soon!!

The Cracked Egg is so bomb! Went here with boyfriend Monday morning. There was a little wait like 10-15 minutes but the food was well worth it. 

I got The Cracked Croissant (egg sandwich, added ham) and hash browns. Boyfriend ordered The Chicken Sandwich and French fries with a side of the polish sausage. They were pretty good sized portions - all for $29.00 - which I thought wasn't bad considering the food was DELICIOUS. This place definitely beats The Omelet House in my book (and I Love the O House). I can't wait to go back! 

The Cracked Egg is probably my favorite breakfast place now - I already know what I want to order next time I come!

This is one of those places that should be your usual spot for breakfast or brunch.  Everything is the way I expected.  I ordered the build your own breakfast skillet and it is simply delicious.  I love their seasoned potatoes and of course, nothing can go wrong the the eggs.  I will go there again and again.

Food was ok. Service was terrible. Never came back after dropping off food. Never offered a refill on coffee or soda then when after 40 minutes came back with bill told us she was busy.  And walked away. Walked past our table next to the entry to food prep area at least 20 times. Never be back. Would not recommend.

I was a little apprehensive about visiting The Cracked Egg since many of the reviews so far weren't so good. I'd been watching the construction of this restaurant since it is very close to my job and I frequent some of the other businesses in the area.

Luckily, either I visited at a good time of day, or they worked out the initial kinks in service, because I had a lovely experience.  The restaurant is bright and cheerful, with a semi-open kitchen. There are several large booths and tables throughout, as well as patio seating (no dogs allowed, the sign is pretty prominent). 

I was seated promptly, my drink order was taken right away, and my server checked on me throughout the meal. I enjoyed my Californian omelette, which was served with a choice of home fries, hash browns, or fruit along with a choice of toast or coffee cake. Next time, I will definitely get the coffee cake, because it looked great. I was able to sample a piece (my friend got the coffee cake), and it was really yummy. Apparently, they have different varieties daily. Prices were reasonable, with most items averaging between $10-$12.

I expect that The Cracked Egg gets really busy on the weekends, and the parking situation was already pretty tight because there are so many other businesses nearby. It is nice having a breakfast/brunch option in Summerlin!

Very nice servers. The food was very good the first visit. Second visit we had a party of 6, nothing was fresh. Food was coming out in spurts, we had to wait 15 minutes for one dish while they served a dish before that to one of our other guests. They were all over the place. I will give them another chance as they were busy but there isn't any excuse for this type of service.

Just finished a delightful breakfast.  I would definitely go back but still doesn't beat my favorite place... Blueberry hill pancake house.  Love the new location of this place. Fast and pleasant service. Never had to wait or ask for a refill on our water and coffee. Coffee cake is a great choice. Moist warm and not overly sweet with the right amount of icing.  I've had the monte crisco at the different location which I do love but this time had the egg white scramble. Nice flavor and a good serving size.  Will be back.

Had the Monte Cristo yesterday!!! Talk about AMAZING!!! One of the best sandwiches I have ever had!! Maybe because it was dipped in French toast batter and deep fried! LOL! SO GOOD! Must try!!!  Waitress was great! Food came out quickly as well!

Order the huevos rancheros sans sour cream mi amigo.  Cream makes it too rich as it is already drowning in queso.  I get this every time.  A sure flavor explosion mejicano style.  Make sure to chose the coffee cake as your side of carb if you want to reach a state of bliss.  Coffee usually not as solid as I like so you have to request multiple cups.  Spacey service but eh.  Share all this unless you are a lumberjack or want a food coma en route to your hike at Red Rock.

Everything here is delicious! My only complaint is that sometimes service can be slow or there's a long wait on weekends, but that tends to happen everywhere on weekends in Vegas. My first love is the Veggie Benny with bacon added, but I've tried many different entrees here and each have been so tasty and cooked perfectly. Also try the montecristo or the croissant French toast. They're both amazing!
The coffee cake was great but everything else was average. I love bacon and the bacon here is bad.

Good gravy!  Good God!  You get a TON of food.  I am still full and i ate there in December.  The omelette I ordered had a TON of avocados on it.  Usually they put like 3 and call it a California Omlette.  But no.  They put like 7 slices.  And did I mention the gravy and biscuits?  Off the strip, waaaay off the strip.  Thats how to appreciate Vegas.

I had my assistant call the Cracked Egg to ask for an owner I could send the below letter to. "Curtis" got on the phone, wouldn't give his last name, and yelled at my assistant! So with no other outlet than Yelp, here's the letter:

To Whom It May Concern:

I live very near the new Cracked Egg restaurant at Charleston and Hualapai. My inquisitive 3-year-old daughter watched with great anticipation as the new "muffin store" was being built, and the morning of 4/27/14 I took her there (she was very excited). I would normally bring my wife and 1-year-old son, but my wife was home sick with a cold.

What followed was the worst customer service experience of my life. Given the recent opening of the restaurant, wait staff and hostesses were understandably unpracticed and the operation wasn't running as smoothly as I expect it will over time. However, when I complained to the manager about needlessly waiting for 15 minutes after it was our turn to be seated, a man approached me, and with no introduction or conversation, promptly escorted me out the front door (my 3-year-old daughter riding on my hip), and rudely and loudly told me to "get in my car, leave, and never come back." I encouraged him to listen to me, his customer, and he rudely told me "look around, are you the only one here with an infant?" 

I'm not a loud, large, or scary-looking man; in fact, I'm a 47-year-old, well-respected member of the business community. I serve on two high profile community boards, and own and operate a small, local business. Suffice it to say, I've never been banned from any establishment, and found the whole experience horrifying, especially in light of having my young daughter with me.

The saddest part of this experience is my 3-year-old daughter now speaks (unsolicited) about the "bad man at the Cracked Egg who wouldn't let us have pancakes and bacon." She shouldn't have to worry about facing hostility at any of our neighborhood establishments. It's shameful.

Sincerely,
Jeff G.

Been here a couple times with my Celiac wife.  They have a legit gluten sensitive menu, although they do share a fryer and toaster. But, they tell you that.  For those that choose GF, you'll maybe not care about the toaster. Wifey just skips the cross-contaminated items and enjoys her meal every time.  Just learned today that in place of their coffee cake which comes with every order, you can not only get the cross contaminated toast, but hey have udi's choc-choc or blueberry muffin. Everyone has always been friendly, prices fair, good food, Celiac friendly.

I have been to several of the cracked egg locations and have never had anything but a great experience. I personally prefer to go to local family owned establishments like this one. I love to get the peanut butter stuffed french toast. I also like to get the build your own skillet because the variety of options they have. I noticed somebody wrote a tip about it but it is worth repeating that their coffee cake is excellent. I might be addicted to it as I can't prevent myself from ordering it whenever I come to the cracked egg. My favorite one to get when it is available is the peanut butter one but they all are good. Over the years I have tried the majority of options they have had on their menu and was always satisfied. This new location is no different. Keep up the good work!

Went there this morning, post piano recital, so probably about 10:30. On a Saturday morning, you expect a wait at that hour. We waited, but briefly, and everyone was very nice. The food was delicious (especially the seasoned potatoes....flavorful and perfectly cooked! Not greasy or bland or overdone like at so many places!) and reasonably priced. We'll definitely be back!
You're normal breakfast fare, with free potatoes and break, i picked coffee bread. Warm, sweet and goes really well with coffee.

Love the way they have their menu and the  yellow card you have next to you that signals waitress if you need service.  The staff is friendly and  so helpful with recommendations  . This place never fails 
Is clean and affordable.

We each out a fair amount and this place is always great. Very accommodating to our special orders. Coffee is always hot and great customer service to keep our cups full! Our children prefer brunch and they have wonderful soups and salads as well as lots of breakfast foods!!

First time here. Heard so much about this place we had to try. I was, sadly disappointed. First the service was not that great. I ordered the blue berry pancakes and they were dry. I asked, twice for additional syrup and by the time I got it my pancakes were cold. They weren't that good to begin with.
Went during mothers day and the wait time was not long at all, everyone was very accommodating and polite. Service was fast and efficient, and we enjoyed the food. Will definitely come back again!

I have been here for breakfast a few times and it is average at best. Small and somewhat bland portions with ok service.  Looking around for another local cafe as I am relatively new to the area. Anyone have any suggestions??
Best breakfast place ever. Good service. I'd eat here every morning if I could. I like that they have an outdoor patio. And I love their breakfast skillets and lunches too!
Love coming here the omelettes are so yummy!! I always get fruit on the side.. It's nice they have gealthy options on their menu
This place gets two stars because the service was good. Our waitress was accommodating. But the food wasn't that great. The food feels like something frozen and got microwaved.
Def the best place to eat breakfast in town. Always fast, always delicious, and everyone is always friendly. Prices are cheap for the quality that you get every single time!

I love having breakfast here and the food is really good. The Veggie Bennie is my fav, but I always do it with scrambled eggs instead of poached. The only thing that holds me back from giving 5 stars is that when sitting outside, the service is much slower. Other than that this place is great.

The Cracked Egg you have done it! Won my future business! I've been trying to find a couple more breakfast places to go to on a regular basis and it's been super difficult! I seem to live by tons of these breakfast places however the past few that I've been to have been hard to beat my all time favorite Pancake House! 

This past Sunday as always I treated my mother to Sunday Brunch and told her that we would try a different place. The Cracked Egg was chosen based on the other errands that had to be ran in that area of town. When we pulled up I just knew the wait was going to be ridiculous based on the amount of cars that were parked outside, boy was I wrong! As I sat patiently waiting I couldn't help but notice all these cute little pictures and signs that had some interesting quotes on them. Less than a 10 minute wait we were seated and provided our menus! Customer service here is very good! Every staff member was smiling and greeting us and the whole vibe just seemed to be pleasant. 

The variety of items on the menu is pretty good! There are tons of things I wanted to try but because an omelet was what my taste buds were screaming about I decided on "The Big Bad Wolf" Mom ordered "The Garden Patch". Who doesn't love cool names for the items they order? Some probably find it cheesy (no pun intended) but I love the creativeness! You get an option of potatoes, toast and coffee cake with any of the omelet's. Since I was already drooling over the previous YELPER's pics of the coffee cake I went with that of course! Something cool that they do is change the flavor of them every so often. Mine just happened to be apple! Yum! When our food arrived everything looked and tasted great! I had to give them a couple extra brownie points for nailing my request for egg whites on the omelet! Majority places NEVER get it correct and I always have to end up sending it back. Can't be trying to kill me with all that cholesterol! 

Check out was great! Our cashier was friendly just like everyone else we encountered that morning! Asked how our dining experience was and even welcomed us back as soon as possible! I noticed as I was paying for our breakfast that they have a rewards program and when I fill this form out I could get $8 off the next breakfast! I can't wait to return! Awesome job guys!

It was really difficult for me to choose what I wanted from the menu, everything sounded so good! 

I really enjoyed what I decided on, the croissant french toast. They didn't skimp out on the berries like most places do- they totally loaded it up! The coffee cake is also to die for. 

My family (whom I went with) also all enjoyed their meals. Also, great service and very friendly staff.
Food was great and came out super fast. The entire staff was friendly. I will come back

It's sorta like Denny's but the menu was more creative... and they had real orange juice.
I wouldn't mind going back again but it will be a while before that happens.

We come here often. The food and service is always great. I like the lighten up. My mother in law likes the veggie Benny. They always have specials. This morning my husband had the stuffed French toast and he said it was very good. We signed up for their mailings and we get coupons for $8 off. Can't beat it.
Amazing breakfast. I had the chili verde rancheros, and it was served in a skillet. The flavor, and the quantity of each ingredient was so well done, it would be very hard to beat.

I guess it's all about location, location, location.  I've been to the Centennial location about 3 times and in those times, I thought that the food was just okay with less than average service.  This time and at the location near Summerlin, I had a different experience.  First of all, the service is completely different here.  From start to finish, I thought that the servers and check out was easy as can be.  As for the food, I decided on trying something different since I wasn't a huge fan of their skillets in the past.  This time I decided on their Cracked Croissant.  This is their breakfast sandwich that consist of a huge buttery croissant, eggs your way, choice of cheese, and choice of meat.  I had this with turkey bacon and let me tell you, this meal way to start the day.  My croissant was so big that I ate it with a knife and a fork (my favorite utensil).  The sandwich was buttery, tasty, and even had enough macros to satisfy my daily needs. Trust me...unsure of what to get here?  At $10.95 with hash browns, try their Cracked Croissant.  

PS:  Only issue was with their hash browns.  I wanted it cooked extra crispy.  They dropped the ball on this one, but my croissant more than made up for it.

I came here on a Monday morning an ordered The Country Benny for $15. 

- Fast and friendly service. I sat down and ordered right away. 
- Not a good price to food ratio. 
- A biscuit split and topped with patty sausage, 2 pooched eggs and smothered in gravy
- Choice of seasoned potatoes or hash browns. I got the hash browns. 
- I guess I was expecting something better than Wicked Spoon's Egg benedict.
- Tasted good, but not great. Enjoyed the gravy, but I think it made it all gooey. But I guess that's the country style. 
- Better with hot sauce! 
- This place is a good alternative if you don't feel like going to Babystacks or HashHouse.

Solid.  I love breakfast, so I liked this place.  Good coffee cake, excellent skillet breakfast.  Good service and nice atmosphere.  I like the sign that says "Unattended children will be given an espresso and a puppy".

:)

2 locations, amazing breakfast choices, what more could you ask for? Oh wait, and they offer lunch options too? Whenever I have friends in town or I can't get a girl to leave the morning after I make sure to take them to the Cracked Egg. I think the employees may be on to me based on the disheveled appearances of my guests during breakfast.

Right, I forgot there's actually food here too. The banana walnut pancakes are basically the nuts and their fresh fruit plate is ACTUALLY fresh fruit unlike most breakfast places. I approve of everything the Cracked Egg does including their reasonable prices and friendly wait staff.

I came for the eggs Benedict for breakfast. I feel like every time I come there is a long wait for a table so I just sit at the bar. The food is good but nothing outstanding. I would like more flavor to the potatoes as they are kind of bland. Service is usually friendly and that's why I go back.

Ok. This is a traditional breakfast restaurant. They open early and close early, so no breakfast at dinner time for you Las Vegas night shift workers. The servers here are friendly. The meals come in heaping portions. Great breakfast restaurant if you are really hungry and ready to eat!!

Customer service is good but always feeling rushed to finish my food on a week day afternoon when I'm just trying to relax. 
& drink prices are little over priced, $3 for orange juice and they don't do any refills.

Had to abandon our attempt for breakfast off the Las Vegas strip- if you go after 9am be prepared for long waits. This restaurant is in North Las Vegas but just a 15 -20 minute ride from the Strip depending which end you coming from.

Great decor and extra clean restaurant. Lately I have found restaurants with many decorations and fixtures do not dust appropriately! The menu is unique which I like a lot! 

My husband had the monte cristo with hashbrowns and it met his expectations- and he has a pretty high bar. I had the bacon cheeseburger scramble with egg whites and it was delicious! The coffee cake was some kind of sinful pumpkin flavor and came out warm. Service was excellent- just enough attention but not annoying. Will go back again!

Well deserved Zagat ratings and Best of Las Vegas awards!

This is my first choice for breakfast!! The homemade coffee cake is out of control. The coffee cake is a different flavor every time but it is always good. The service is quick and the servers are always friendly. This restaurant is almost always busy but there is usually an available spot at the bar!

My favorite little omelette place in town!  My grandpa and I are regulars here and we can't get enough  We come about once a week and just love it, always a new kind of coffee cake, and every time it's delicious  very good customer service aswell
Pancakes & French Toast YUM!!! That alone makes this place 5 stars....PERIOD!! Well - 1 star for prices.

Terrible terrible service, the coffee was watered down... coffee cake was tasteless and my toast finally came when I was finished with my food. the chicken in the green omelet was really dry. I waved down the hostess while she was having a conversation with an employee and she put her finger up for me to wait... and she finished her conversation (which I could hear because she was a table away)... go to rise and shine, bite, crepe expectations... much better service. The server asked if everything was good. I told her no and she jumped to say have a nice day... that's it... no apology

Fairly good food but the coffee cake was not what I was expecting.  Apparently they change the type of coffee cake daily so we got red velvet cake with icing, not real coffee cake. The sign which lists this is only visible when leaving and there is no warning on the menu!  When mentioned to the waitress, no apology in the least!  The raspberries in the mixed fruit bowl were great but the blueberries were over-ripe and awful!  So a mixed experience.  When we went to the cash register, a waitress had leftsomeone's VISA card sitting there with no one manning the register!!  I could have taken a photo, memorized the # or walked away with it!  Pay in person at the register!!

This really is a pretty good breakfast spot. Good service, good food.
My husband loves their biscuits and gravy, so we come here at least a couple times a month.

Service was fast! Food was amazing ! Price was really cheap! $22 for two meals. The place was packed but they were still quick. We were in and out in 25-35min. The staff and cook are in there A game! The eggs benne were on point!
I've been on this earth for 23 year and finally found the best French toast I ever had!! Get the Peanut butter French toast!! You'll be in peanut heaven!!

Mother's Day. Thought we would be waiting forever. To my surprise they were properly staffed. 6 of us in my family and our order came out in under 10 minutes. Food was delicious. Service was fantastic. Food was hot and ready to eat. Great job..
Service and food were just alright. Prefer the Original Pancake house for taste. Price is about the same.

I've lived next to this place for 15 years & never thought to go inside until a friend invited me. To my surprise, it was a cute setting with motivational quotes on the wall & such friendly staff. Inside was clean & quiet. The food tasted great! I got the California omelette & a cup of coffee (not diluted w/ too much water). I recommend this place if you want a good & quiet breakfast!

Tried this place for the first time today . I have drives in this plaza with tropical smoothie and the other stores multiple times and never even knew this restaurant was here . All the booths were taken when we went here , and we took that as a good sign. We didn't have to wait longer than maybe 15 minutes for one though. They have a good kids menu and good pencils and activity menu to keep the children entertained. I had a breakfast burrito with eggs potatoes and cheese and added spinach and it was delicious. The service was very good and they were very attentive and on top of everything . We were very happy with everything and will definitely be going back

We have been here twice now. The food is very tasty and the speed and quality of service is phenomenal. We've only been there on week days and while crowded we didn't have to wait to be seated. Everyone raves about the coffee cake. I can't say I was all that impressed. Perhaps it's because they heat it in a microwave before serving. I would have given them five stars if it wasn't for this and the prices being a bit high. All in all a great experience.

I posted a pic so you could see.  The helps' drinks are all kept on the counter, just inches from where the customer eats.  At one pt, a waiter left a piece of coffee cake on the counter, on "his side" of the misc dirty dishes, and when I asked, "is this mine?" he said that it was for another customer.  So its a holding spot, a sipping station for the waitstaff, AND a counter for the customers.  I literally gobbled 2 bites of my tasty, hot food, had it boxed up, and ate at home, from my own clean counter.  Also the wait staff yell standing over you, from the computer on one side, to the kitchen on the other.
So many places to eat in Vegas....it was stressful, dirty, and no separation from my dishes and dirty dishes.  The health dept should really show up and eat at the counter sometime.  By the time they said they were charging me for salsa for my eggs, I said, "sure, why the hell not?  You've already made this a horrible experience."
I stopped in while having my car serviced next door.  Clearly a fairly large contingent of regulars!  I didn't have any fancy.. just sausage,eggs and coffee but the service was fast and friendly.

Great breakfasts. I love their seasoned potatoes and different egg scrambles. If you haven't tried their coffee cake you must go now.  The food was served fast but the rest of the service left more to be desired.

My family and I have been here several times.  The service is always friendly and the food is great.  Sometimes there is a wait on the weekends but it never is long.  They have lots of menu choices and it always comes out hot and fast.  I always ask for iced coffee but they don't normally serve it.  A regular waiter there always makes it for me special.  All of the servers are nice.  I love that they have a loyalty program and give out their own card.  We get lots of coupons to return and get decent amounts off of our bill.  Go here and have a great breakfast.

The best breakfast hand down, service is great and they have great offer for repeated guests.
If you haven't been there you better start going, you won't regret it.

You will get a solid breakfast here.  The service is fast and the selection is pretty good.  But it's just ok for us.  Nothing special, just a normal breakfast house.  Doesn't stand out and the environment is very cafeteria like.  It gets VERY loud in here, and you can hear every kid complaining about their meal.  

If you are looking for a good meal with decent prices and you just need to fill your belly and go, this place will work fine for you.  If you want to enjoy your breakfast, speak with your significant other and just chill, don't bother.  We felt rushed and there was just way too much noise.

There is a patio outside in the strip mall.  I do not know if they will give you table service outdoors though.  We never asked, but if it's not too hot, that could be a good option to avoid the noise.
The Service is great, the Food is awesome. Coffee cake yummy, pancakes fabulous . I recommend this place whenever u r in Las Vegas!
Had Breakfast  here this morning! Fantastic.... try the Big Bad Wolf ! Great service ... good food !! Las Vegas this is good food!

The coffee cake is awesome. I think it was pumpkin raisin bread. Not sure if that is their regular coffee cake or if its a seasonal cake. I went twice to the same location. The first time I tried their Southwest Scramble, menu said chorizo and jalapeño. Sounded pretty good at the time. It was ok, not what I expected...Not much chorizo and the jalapeños were the pickled kind, wasn't expecting pickled jalapeño with eggs, but it wasn't bad.....you get a nice portion of potatoes. The second time I went back I ordered your simple bacon and eggs, I was less impressed the second time around. My food was barely warm. The servings were a little skimpier this time, but the coffee cake was still the best part. I may go back, but probably won't be a regular spot.....still searching for that perfect breakfast place.

Great local breakfast place.  Nice selection of pancakes, egg dishes, skillets, fruits and beverages.  Service is friendly and prompt.  Creative menu items and coffee cakes and croissants are delicious.  Prices are reasonable and outdoor seating option is nice.  Too loud for a business meeting but seating is spacious.

I made the mistake of ordering Joe's Scramble thinking It might be a close relative of San Francisco's Joe's Special. Think again. A thick layer of cheese, microscopic bits of spinach, possibly some ground beef, a paltry amount of scrambled egg, no seasoning...... Forget about it!

Please put the Snicker Doodle stuffed french toast on your regular menu ! IT was sooooo good and we tried to go back the follow week to have it again, only to find that it was the "special" for a short time.

I saw this place had great reviews, however we must of went on a bad day! We were a table of 8 and went during a week day...it took over 40 minutes to get our meal! I would expect that if it were a weekend but with only 4 other tables filled with people that already had their food not sure why it took so long to cook eggs! I think what was more upsetting that 3 other tabes were filled after we got there and they got their food before we did!!!
Sorry to say will not reccommend this palce. :-(

Yelp helps again!   I was in the area a few weeks ago with a buddy of mine and we needed some breakfast before heading out for a day of adventure.   We scanned yelp and it told us about the Cracked Egg.   We got there a little late, around 9:30 on a Friday morning.   We were promptly seated and received oj and coffee.   I ordered Joe's scramble and my buddy ordered an omelet.   Both were really good with large portions.   One thing they do at the Cracked Egg is to add cream cheese to the eggs to make them a little smoother and richer.  It's a nice touch if you like cream cheese.   The only complaint I have is they forgot our toast.   But the portions were so large, we really didn't miss the toast.   Also, the place was a little noisy due to a party of six celebrating a birthday.   But other than that, it was a nice place to grab some breakfast.   
Will I be back?   Sure, I could see myself going back at some point.
Went today for brunch, egg Benedict was yum. My family also enjoyed their meal . Service is good too
i been going to this place for almost 3 years.. an i always get the steak an eggs.. soo good... a great place to bring ur family too... it gets pack on weekends but it worth waiting..

Too crowded for my taste. Coffee cake is nice and warm, food is good, not knock your socks off good. I got the regular grand slam like breakfast and it was alright. Prices are okay too, but u would t go out of my way for this place.

ummm coffee cake sooooo fresh and delicious!!! WOWZA! this place had some amazing food and great fast service! I loved my breakfast coming into town meeting friends there was a perfect way to start my Vegas trip. The menu is filled with so many selections that the average Joe would have a hard time deciding which to choose! You want a good affordable breakfast, or any other meal this would be the yum spot!

My boyfriend and I always love coming here! Prices are great, service is great, and the place has a nice family restaurant/diner feel that I love (Im from Connecticut so i'm used to small town diners). Today our servers name was Jose, he was really nice and not pushy like some servers could be! We got omelets, I had the greek replaced with cheddar, and a coffee cake (today it was a super yummy pumpkin flavor). My boyfriend was plain jane and got toast with his western omelet. (he soon wished he had gotten yummy coffee cake too!). Though it was pretty busy when we got there at 11ish, we only waited about 5 minutes to sit :)

3.5 Stars!

The Cracked Egg is a quality breakfast spot!  The specialty is their homemade Coffee Cake that rotates through a variety of flavors.  Most are great!  The owners are also incredibly nice, and truly put the customer first.

With several enjoyable entree options, the Cracked Egg is a place I will gladly go for breakfast.  I usually end up with the Benedict Ole, Southwest Scramble, or Cracked Croissant.  This is a great spot Monday - Friday...but can be crowded on the weekends for obvious reasons.

Great place to have breakfast instead of the usual breakfast spots. The service was friendly, but the food was not so fast coming to the tables. It is a popular restaurant with sometimes a wait. I will be returning soon to try other items on the menu.

Nice place to get away from the strip and the temptation of a pricey breakfast buffet.  Our waiter was very pleasant and quickly brought our food out.  I had the cracked egg croissant, with choice of scrambled eggs over pepper jack and sausage.  Sadly and unexpectedly, it was the most bland thing ever.

I love the Cracked Egg!  It is a great breakfast/lunch place that you NEED to check out!

The menu is fantastic here.  The breakfast side has all of your favorites, along with some more fun options to spice up your breakfast.  I think my favorite breakfast dish is the Cakes & Eggs combo.  Eggs any style, sausage/bacon, hash browns and pancakes.  Everything that makes breakfast wonderful in one serving.  YUM!

For brunch, you have got to get the Monte Cristo sandwich.  It is a ham, turkey, and cheese club made with French Toast!!!!  Yep, you heard me right, French Toast.  I absolutely love this sandwich.

The lunch menu is great as well.  My husbands dreams about the tuna melts, my daughter demands their chicken fingers, and I usually grab a burger.  So far, everything I have tried has been tasty and have not been disappointed one bit.

They also have a membership program that you can sign up for free.  Once you are in the system, they will send you an $8 off coupon every month.  The coupon has no rules except you have to come in, simple as that.  So sign up for the club and start getting coupons.  The club also gives you a $10 off check for every $250 you spend.  Don't you just love coupons?

With tons of variety so that everyone in your group can find something to eat, makes the Cracked Egg a great place to visit! The staff is always friendly and makes you feel welcome. Oh and the coffee cake is divine!  That is the trifecta of a great restaurant in my opinion.  Go check it out and be amazed.

I used to consult for a Vegas telecom business, and each and every time I went I would beg my clients to go to the Cracked Egg with me.  Situated at the Flynn Gallagher plaza next to Starbucks, this little gem of a place serves up the best Eggs Benedict ever - I usually get mine with Avocado and Tomato because I'm a bleeding-heart vegetarian, and they are so divine.  I actually sit on the plane ride there and daydream the whole time (and salivate, too) about what I'm going to inhale at this charming little nook.  

This client of mine hired other consultants, too, who flew in from various places as Denver and New Jersey and Texas, and we all agreed that we would somehow conspire to conjure up a reason to have a business breakfast/lunch at the Cracked Egg.

This is by far my favorite Breakfast place in Vegas. It has a great staff always friendly! The food is alway sooo fresh and good! The Eggs Benedict is my favorite! I also love the Buffalo chicken salad.
The service and food are outstanding.  I ordered an omelet and cooked it to order with the changes that I requested.

Went there for lunch with the hubby, and the breakfast was horrible.  The slice of ham was thin & leathery to the point of being unable to cut into it.  The hash browns were dry and tasteless.  Even the toast was badly done, one dot of butter in the middle part of burnt & dry toast.  I'll give them credit for the eggs, and that's it.
I was not very impressed with this restaurant.  Prices were ok but the menu was not easy to read and highly unimpressive creations.  I may go back, then again I may not.  3 stars as I am undecided.
The staff was nice and professional. The food was good and hot!!! I will eat here again when I returned to Vegas.
Love to eat here for breakfast when i get a chance too! Very friendly and excellent customer service. Love their coffee cakes before the meal. 4 stars because it should be bigger!

No wonder this place was voted Best in Vegas! The breakfast was very yummy! If you do want something other then breakfast, their salads are huge! 

The place gets pretty busy so expect a little bit of a wait.

If you go with the breakfast, here is a good tip get the coffee cake it is very good!
Great service! Breakfast was tasty and you must try the coffee cake. Small local resturant with home feel.

Way above average breakfast spot. To be honest...the portions are too big here...the prices are too expensive...the food is excellent and the service is very prompt. you must come here hungry or don't bother. I had the big bad wolf fluffy and folded omelet..loaded with ingredients. Wife had the tropical French toast..topped with coconut..macadamia nuts and bananas. she was thrilled with her selection. My son had the huevos rancheros. we were all happy campers..even the hash browns were delicious. This is a solid place...its a mini chain( 5 locations) in greater vegas. Noisy,crowded and very very good.
Awesome food and great service. Went here 2x on business trip and loved it!  Generous portions for both meals. Coffee cake is great! Recommend the skillets!

Love love love this place for breakfast or brunch! I usually always get their country fried steak and eggs..never disappointed. Its hot and fresh with a great country gravy and fried breakfast potatoes. Their omelets are also delicious. And with every entree order u xan get a coffee cake. Everyday the coffee cake is a different flavor..my favorite is the banana bread coffee cake.

Decided to finally try this place out. It's a cute little place to have breakfast with a great variety of foods to choose from. 

I got the Country Benny which is biscuits and gravy with poached egg. It was really good but I couldn't finish it. I would have liked a little bit more gravy to compliment the amount of biscuits there is.

My beau got the Carnitas omelette. It was pretty good. Only complaint is that the vegetables (onions, bell pepper) needed to be cut in smaller pieces. 

On beautiful days like today you can actually sit outside to eat.

Bit of mixed feelings on this place, and I will tell you why...

My Eggs Benedict was not good, at least not worth it for the price. They were tasteless and the Hollandaise was watery, not thick and creamy. Ended up throwing most of it away.

Their prices are a bit much, especially on such simple items.

Although, I ate some of my fiancee's S'mores French Toast with Nutella and it was amazing. And huge portions as well. They had some really interesting menu choices that ARE worth the price.

Case in point, can be worth it if you end up getting what you pay for.

Best breakfast place in Vegas hands down. If you love breakfast, you'll love the Cracked Egg.

Had a weird experience at the Cheyenne location. Being younger, I assume that my server assumed me being young meant that I would tip her less than 20%. That was not the case as she ignored me my whole experience. I took it up to the register and the problem wasn't addressed. I got a measly senior discount. Though I appreciate a discounted check for a mediocre experience, that doesn't change anything.

Also noticed that their is an option between COFFEE CAKE or TOAST..

She insisted on just asking me what kind of TOAST I wanted. I didn't want TOAST. I wanted COFFEE CAKE and as a returning guest, I let her know that. 

Other experiences at the location have been awesome. As well as the fe visits i've paid to the ANN location.

I am a big fan of their seasoned potatoes.

One of the best breakfast places I have eaten at. I come here every time I am in Vegas for business. The prices are reasonable and the food is really good. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good place to have breakfast.

This is one of my first and favorite breakfast places to eat in Vegas. I was in the neighborhood so I decided to stop by. 

I ordered my usual the Northshore Scramble which has tomatoes, grilled onions, bacon, Jack and Cheddar cheese, with sour cream on  top. It came with seasoned potatoes and I ordered avocado on the side. It was good as always especially on top of the buttered sourdough bread. The seasoned potatoes also had a good flavor and they were not salty. 

My husband ordered a Tuna Salad sandwich with a side of fries. They accidentally gave him fresh fruit but when they found out their mistake they also gave him  his fries. I had a bite of the sandwich and the tuna was really good it had a "zing" to the taste. 

I like the location of this Cracked Egg because it's inside a little mini food court that has a Starbucks, Subway, Gyro, and Pizza place. It has something for everyone just in case you are with people with different tastes you can all eat together in their outdoor seating area.

BEWARE OF TERRIBLY SLOW SERVICE.

I've been to cracked egg twice so far. the first time it was slow and the service was even slower. the 2nd time i went it was busier. and the service was still terribly slow. 1) never took our drink order. 2) went straight to food order cause of long wait. 2) forgot my coffee cake 3) forgot my to go box. 4) forgot my to go box. AGAIN. proceeding long wait.
it is a bad sign when your waitress has to apologize to you every time she approaches the table. YOU ARE DOING SOMETHING WRONG. 
side note: i did get the same waitress both visits. 

had the PB stuff french toast. SUPER DUPER YUMMY IN MY TUMMY!! if you're looking for something sweet savory and all around goodness. this will hit the spot. its heavy so don't expect to be productive the rest of the bad. pair that with the coffee cake and its game over. nap time. i could only eat half.

also had the corn beef hash. quite good as well. i felt like they were filling the giant platter they brought me with potato though to use as a filler to cover up the plate. i didn't like the additional semi mashed potato added to my corned beef plus the additional side of potatoes/hash browns. that's a little potato overload.

okay. granted the terrible service might be due to a terrible waitress. it still put a damper on my experience. their lucky the food is good or i wouldn't come back.

This place is awesome. Hands down the best breakfast joint in Las Vegas. My wife and I eat here every week. The food is very good. The cooks are excellent and also present the food very well. The service is completely phenomenal. The wait staff there are hand-picked and fit the environment of the restaurant. They care about the restaurant and seem like a big family. If your server doesn't bring you a coffee refill, someone else will. 

To anyone that thinks Babystacks is better: the village must have lost an idiot. We went to Babystacks this morning.  It was horrible. The seating is very uncomfortable. The staff is all young and seem very inexperienced. The food was subpar with a higher price tag.  Would never eat there again. 

Cracked Egg you are awesome and your owners must really know how to run a restaurant. Unlike most of the other restaurants in town. Great job.

Choose this location over the painted mirage one! Food is always what should be & they comply with allergies. 

They're quick & much more friendly. 10/10

this place is a quaint little place that we met friends at.  Went based on their recommendations a lot but this place is very efficient. the staff was great and helpful, always responding to us quickly.  
the food was good and came out exactly how we wanted it.  there are many options on the menu for all taste buds.  I got the fruit side with my eggs and it was a nice change with grapefruit, watermelon and honeydew rather than your typical fruit mix.  It was all nice and fresh too. Per their recommendation we shared a piece of the crumb cake.  Wasn't your typical crumb cake, more like a light fluffy piece of cake with some cream cheese bottom and icing on top but it was well balanced and the cheese wasn't overwhelming. My understanding is the flavors change too, will have to see. 
They do have a frequent rewards/point card that they tell me gives you good coupons.  Would definitely go back.
They say what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas, but there was so much bland, rubbery cheese on my thin, dead omelette that I'll probably be crapping it out for weeks.
This place has really good food. The Price is why its a 4 star though.  They have a great cobb salad!  Bacon and eggs are great with there home style potatoes.  I always take this to go!
My family and I love this place because it is fast, convenient, great service and just plain old good breakfast. I highly recommend this restaurant and it is also family friendly.

We met a couple of friends for breakfast here at the Cracked Egg.  This is a place they bring friends for the first time.  So, how could we say "NO"... I'm glad we didn't.  We looked over the menu and everything looked great.  I ended up with a skillet filled with pork.  Can't go wrong.  The bottom was covered with home potatoes then came the eggs and pork.  I decided to get toast as I knew I would finish Michele's coffee cake.

I would definitely come back again for breakfast.

Can get coffee cake with meal.

This is one of my alltime favorite breakfast joints. I don't know why. The food isn't that spectacular. I think its the creativity of the items and large menu selection that sticks me. 

There's also two vegetarian items that are really good: The Veggie Benny (vegetarian eggs benedict) and the Veggie Croissant (with garlic mayo so good, make me wanna slap yo momma). 

They're prices are a little steep, being a breakfast place in Summerlin. And they get totally hammered during prime breakfast hours, so I'd recommend going sub primetime. They have indoor and uncovered outdoor seating. 

Get the coffee cake. The Kickin' Potatoes (their spunked-up version of potatas bravas) are supposed to be a signature item ... they a'ight. 

* off the strip, non-casino

This place was amazing. Had country fried steak with hashbrowns and 2 eggs. Also a side of bacon and hot chocolate. Pretty busy area but did not wait very long. Our server Nicole was very nice and came back to make sure we enjoyed our food. This place is a bit pricey but I did enjoy my experience here and will come back again!

I love this little gem. The breakfast menu is so good. I love all the choices and imagination here. So many places do a same ole same ole approach to the most important meal of the day, but the folks at the Cracked Egg start the day off right with fresh made coffee cake and Delicious dished that will elate your palate. 

I love you Cracked egg. Now gimme a little of that sugar.
First time there .great service yummy food I had the south shore scramble. Very good . Will be back for sure. Great coffee
Small place and busy but definitely worth the wait.  Most waitstaff is very friendly, food is amazing, gluten free options are terrific, and it's right down the street; we come about once a week.
Service is exceptional! Food is great! This is our (my wife & I) new spot for BCC-breakfast, chat, & coffee.

It's open only for breakfast/lunch hours. Is located in a food court setting, with outdoor seating options. Device was friendly as fast. Seats are metal with some cushion. Not the type to stay for hours, but serviceable comfy. For a neighborhood breakfast joint, it delivers better than expected. 

Will definitely come again.

Found this place through yelp when I wanted a unique breakfast away from the tourists and chain restaurants. Comments were noting the high prices but I found they were generally several dollars cheaper than the IHOP breakfast I had the day before. This was the most unique and best tasting breakfast I've had in a long, long time. I walked away very full and completely satisfied. I will be visiting again on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Headed there this Sunday morning...Busy as usual.  We were told 15 min wait but it was more like 1/2 an hour.  This morning my hubby ordered the veggie skillet (seasoned potatoes, shrooms, broccoli, spinach & tomatoes , eggs) & added corned beef.  I had the California Omelette (avocado, bacon & jack cheese) with the skillet potatoes.  

My omelette was fine.  The bacon inside was not cut up causing it to be a bit more difficult to bite into without taking half the bacon in a single bite!The potatoes were perfect-no grease what so ever! My hubby was pleased with his skillet but was slightly disappointed that it took forever to get his coffee (which is not worth the $2.00 price). 

Given how busy the place was, service was good (even with the lag in coffee).  We also had an $8.00 coupon sent to us by that Cracked Egg making it a good deal.  Withoout the coupon I doubt we would make a special trip out there any time too soon.

I enjoy going to the cracked egg. I don't go often, but when I do--it's usually this location (although I've been to all of them), and they seem to always get it right here. I've never had to complain about my food (although I order the same thing every time for brunch-chicken fingers and hash browns with whatever coffee cake is being served). That's unless I get the BLT, which is great as well. The feel of the location is very "at home having brunch or lunch in your kitchen," it's small, usually packed, but the staff is great at getting people in and out in a timely and orderly fashion. Try to avoid the location off Ann/95--there's always issues there.

Today was scheduled to be very busy with little room for disappointments. Cracked Egg representatives did not help prevent my low brow for them today.  It's is for this reason,  that I attribute my dissatisfaction to the led than perfect rating that I've given. 

In effort to keeping on schedule, and allowing for preparation for my next stop,  I opted to call in my order. Only to find my calls unanswered on both attempts. The parking lot illustrated  that there should not be many to warrant a busy occurrence such as answered calls. So I found myself walking in to place my order in person. From there, everything  went without a hitch.  Food was made so very timely and there was more than enough staff to accommodate my phone order. 

I don't like writing bad reviews so when I do experience less them 5 star service,  I include as much detail as possible. There was nothing wrong with their phones because a test call went  right through while I waited for my food to arrive and my earlier call was mere 40 feet away. 

Bottom line, this place still rocks. Just don't rely on saving time by calling in ahead. There may be something that prevents the call from being taken.  :/

Great breakfast dishes and friendly and helpful servers.
What more do you need in an egg restaurant?

I highly recommend the Veggie Eggs Benedict. It's delicious!

First official brunch after relocating to Vegas from NY. Had the cheeseburger skillet. The dish was well prepared and seasoned. Asked for eggs to be over medium but came in over easy, however there'hing wrong with runny eggs over your bacon cheeseburger goodness. The included coffee cake with its sweet notes and creamy center was an excellent compliment to the dishes savory notes. 

Menu pricing is fair. Service is stellar. 

 Store opens at 6am..perfect. 

I would see myself frequenting this place.

I thought it was a decent breakfast.
We had a 2-1 coupon from the R-J.
Coffee was good.
I think the atmosphere was pretty bland.
It was kind of dark inside, with no TV monitors. 

Don't think I'd return unless I had a coupon.
3 stars.
Very fast, fresh and awesome food. I ordered Toris Burrito and loved every bite! I highly recommend this place! The next time Im going to order the crosiant!
Fast and friendly service mixed with great food. Wait times can be long on weekends, but well worth it.
Places like this will put Denny's and ihop out of business. 5 stars is not enough to explain how amazing this place is. Delish.

Came here for breakfast today. We live in california and are here for a couple of days. I got the skillet and added ground beef and bell peppers. It was one of the best skillets ive ever had. My boyfriend got the waffle and it was okay. The hostess at the front was a little grumpy which killed the mood a little BUT the skillet is what made me give 4 stars. I might be back tomorrow just to get that skillet one more time ;)
First timer. Had the Monte Cristo. It was delicious! Service was fantastic. I'll be back.

Great food great service! Nice variety!
I love the chicken fried steak and eggs with country sausage gravey!  My wife lives the strawberry cream cheese stuffed French Toast.

Was on vacation from Chicago looking for a place to eat while we were driving around exploring found the cracked egg very impressed food fresh and good when we return to Las Vegas will definitely go there again for breakfast. Server recommended a couple dishes she was spot on on everything she recommended

Well I have been here several times and the breakfast is always fantastic. But today I tried a burger. The burger looked and tasted like it was a frozen patty. No taste to it. Next time I'll stick to the breakfast items.  And yes the coffee cake is so delicious!!!!!

This was our second visit to Cracked Egg in the last 3 weeks.  Both times the 3 of felt that while the food was good the portions size was lacking for the $$.
Ignacio had the eggs benedict and there was as most a couple tablespoons of hollandaise sauce spread across the tops of the two soft poached eggs.  Of course when he asked for more a nice portion arrived. Uriel had a chicken wrap and again while good it lacked a decent amount of goodies inside.  I had the Corned beef Reuben and again lacked a nice amount of meat and even kraut, also the rye was not well toasted.
We will  probably try here again for breakfast as the service was great and friendly.

I stopped here for breakfast yesterday and it was very good.  I ordered the Tropical French toast, two pieces of bread dipped in egg, coated with some toasted coconut and macadamia nuts, and nicely grilled.  

I sat at the counter and the place was quite busy.  Maybe it just seemed that way because no one was eating outside because it was RAINING!  

Service was very quick and everyone was pleasant and had a nice smile.  I only had one cup of coffee but I was asked about a refill.  I was giving platelets later and I didn't want to be sitting the hour and a half in the chair when the coffee want to leave me.  Also, thanks to the restaurant for having a half order as an option.  That was just enough!

One thing that would really make this breakfast tropical would be to replace the maple syrup with coconut syrup.  Now that's tropical!

Nothing special. Seems family owned and operated with people there who might not be too experienced. Had a simple French toast was okay and upon seeing the workers there. I noticed most of them had an assembly line going on. Someone specifically cutting the bread there. Putting things in and out of microwaves. Their pumpkin bread cake. Pancakes even microwaved. I probably could have made the same quality of food in my kitchen. It's just goes to show if you have a market and your in there at the right place, at the right time.
The chicken fried steak is as good as anything I've ever had in Dixie, and the service was likewise. Excellent alternative to Baby Cakes, and destined to be just as famous.  Great place!

This place is amazing!! While in Vegas, my family and I were trying to find a great place to have breakfast and we came across The Cracked Egg via Yelp and so glad we decided to try it. The food is fantastic and the staff was so great!! Thank you!

Best breakfast the west coast has ever seen.  From eggs and sausage, to french toast. Been going here for years and it never dissapoints. Everything is always fresh, quick and inexpensive. And their home fries are awesome!

I would even add another half star to this. I didn't give it 5 stars only because I don't think breakfast should cost $12.00.  BUT......
Food was so good!  And big sized. Biscuits and gravy are phenomenal, homemade. Meals are served with big slices of coffee cake. And service is so friendly.  There's a wait, but it goes fast.  We ordered biscuits & gravy, southwest scramble, and Benedict ole. Everything was tasty and hit the spot. Leaving here stuffed and happy.

Always Very Very good. The Big Bad Wolf or Kicking potatoes are my personal Fav. I can't go 5 stars because they changed thier coffe cake recently (for the worse). It's always a good sign when a places hours are from 7-3, to me it's a sign of a good breakfast place!

Best place for some good ol' breakfast.  We made our way here on Saturday morning with the craving of their melt in your mouth crumb cake.  We were seated pretty quickly...the place was full.  I decided to be different and order the corn beef hash.  Usually I go for the boring eggs and potatoes but I was going all out that day.  The portion was massive.  Alot of onions...like more than the corn beef but I just ate around them.  It came with eggs (egg beaters) potatoes on the side and wheat toast.  Whew it was alot and by alot I mean ALOT!  When I was done she asked if I liked it because it didnt look like I ate anything. haha  It was pretty darn good though.   I probably would get it again.  

The BF ordered the kickin potatoes and the crumb cake.  Kickin potatoes are always solid...a combo of potatoes, bacon, cheese, salsa and sour cream (I think thats whats in it)   He loves them.  Now the crumb cake....amazing as usual.  Sometimes they come in different flavors but this time it was just plain cinnamon-just the way I like.  It was so hot when it came out that it was steaming.  the cake just fell apart as you tried to cut through it.  Just the little things.

Cracked Egg is always a solid local find.  There arent too many breakfast places that are not chain restaurants that I can say live up to the breakfast standards but this one surely does!

I've been here twice for breakfast. The portions are nice but the prices are a little high. The first time I went I had the eggs benedict, which would have been wonderful if it weren't for the mysterious piece of gristle in my ham. They serve the eggs on a very thick slice of ham, which had a really smooth smoky flavor.The home fries are delicious! The second time I went was on a Saturday morning, which meant waiting for 45 minutes for a table. That time I ordered the chicken fried steak, which was very satisfying. It was a large piece of steak and had the nice crispy crust that I like. The gravy was rich and smooth, not chalky like some tend to be. My Mother-in-law ordered the french toast and loved it. 

I really like this place, it's just too long of a wait and a little overpriced.

OHHHH EMMMM GEEEE!!! I had the best breakfast this morning at the Cracked Egg..It was D-Lish! Their skillets are really good and that coffee cake is AMAZING! Not too much food and wasn't too pricey either. A great place for breakfast, its a little small, but you always have the option to eat outside. I must try people!!

I was issued a comp once I emailed the company about our first visit, we went back today. I am happy to report this visit was a lot better the manager was friendly when we walked in and the staff was very nice, the food was also very good. Thank you for a positive experience with myself my friend and out two toddlers.

I ordered a Mexican Skillet and my friend ordered a Western omelet with egg whites. Both of us got toast, which came already buttered. The skillet was delicious. I substituted hash browns for seasoned potatoes because I prefer a little crisp and it was perfect. There was a little bit more cheese than I preferred but still palatable. The coffee was good- even came with fresh vanilla creamer. Good service and good food. Can't ask for anything more.
Came here for some breakfast.  I had the chorizo and eggs which was good but the eggs could have been cooked a little more.  Other than that the meal was good.

My bf & I went into the cracked egg on July 5th 2015 . Between eleven & noon.
It was very busy.
Maybe two tables available if that . We got seated very fast . Very friendly waitress 
We ordered the monte cristo 
Ham , turkey,  Swiss cheese in french toast deep fried! 
& a Denver omlet , which she kindly let me substitute sausage instead of ham. ( im 8 months pregnant & picky ) 
Both came with potatoes ( hash or seasoned , we ordered one of each)
& the omlet came with toast or coffee cake!
I ordered coffee cake.
Two waters & one soda.
To our surprise our food was ready so fast! Mayb 10 mins!
 ( idk maybe we got lucky! )
We both LOVED our meals & were so satisfied. They have large portions.
( Omlets are jade with 3 eggs) 
We both took half our meals home!
The COFFEE CAKE is to die for!
Best I've ever had. Seriously so moist & sweet. Loved it. I would go back just for the cake. 
Prices were fair. More or less IHOP type prices. ( but the quality is much better) 
Our total was 23 dollars & change. 
I have nothing to complain about. 
I didn't hear one complaint from any customers around me. I find that rare , I always here someone at least say, "oh you forgot this" but no everyone was on their game! 
My bf hates going out to dine in places, ( he's a homebody) but said he would love to come back to this place!
We plan to take family & friends here when they come out to Vegas to visit 
Great job to the staff!
A++ thanks guys!
What can I say other than I love the French toast. It always hits the spot and this place is always packed.

Cracked Egg gets my vote for the most underrated breakfast on the NW side of Vegas. While there is a 30 min wait across the street at Babystacks, we are welcomed on a Sunday morning with the option of dining indoors or out! 
The coffee is strong, the service is great, and the food comes out pretty quickly and hot! 
I love that there are not so classis breakfast options with peppers and chilies. A huge variety of omelets, and of course some basic eggs and bacon as well. 
On my most recent visit, I went with the special on the board which was a fried French toast with berries. Literally, the BEST French toast I ever had! I devoured all 4 thick sliced and was STUFFED! 
My daughter got one of the specialty French toasts on the menus, and hers came with 6 slices. Not sure what the difference was, maybe because mine was the special. Either way I am not complaining at all, both were excellent! 
I feel like the staff has all been here for a while, and they got it down well! I also love that some of the dishes are names based on the surrounding neighborhoods. (North shore/South shore etc) 
The décor, reminds me of someone's grandmothers kitchen. I love the sign that says, "We have no Wifi, pretend it's 1995 and talk to each other". 
Delicious, home-style cooking in a neighborhood setting, perfect for everyone!
Staff is friendly and helpful. Food is always yummy. We've tried a few different things and everything is consistently good.

Perfect breakfast spot, they have some really good chorizo and potatoes, and omelets. Also their coffee cake is so fresh and fluffy. Service is great but it gets super packed on weekends so maybe call ahead of time to see how long the wait is. Other than that great place to eat especially for breakfast.
I probably have dined here a dozen times. Very good food that is consistent. Excellent customer service. I highly recommend their scrambles. Especially Joes scramble.
